mt: He was thus honored with the title of "Hero of the Soviet Union" for his achievements.
ref: He received the "Hero of the Soviet Union", the Soviet Union's highest honor, for his work.

src: 10 年後，他帶領阿波羅-聯盟測試計劃中的蘇聯部份，象徵了太空競賽的結束。
mt: Ten years later, he led the Soviet part of the Apollo-Soyuz test program, symbolizing the end of the space race.
ref: Ten years later, he led the Soviet part of the Apollo–Soyuz mission symbolizing that the Space Race was over.

src: 她說：「無情報指出會發生立即性的攻擊。
mt: She said: "No information indicates that an immediate attack will occur.
ref: She said, "There is no intelligence to suggest that an attack is expected imminently.

src: 然而，威脅程度降低至『嚴重』並不代表整體的威脅消失了。」
mt: However, reducing the threat level to "serious" does not mean that the overall threat has disappeared. "
ref: However, the reduction of the threat level to severe does not mean the overall threat has gone away."

src: 馬里蘭交通管理局無法確定威脅是否屬實，但在聯邦調查局的力勸下依然決定關閉。
mt: The Maryland Transportation Authority was unable to determine whether the threat was true, but under the urging of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, it still decided to close.
ref: While authorities are unsure of the credibility of the threat, the Maryland Transportaion Authority made the closure with the urging of the FBI.

src: 自卸卡車被用來堵住隧道的各個入口處，並在 80 名警力的協助下指揮駕駛們改道行駛。
mt: The self-loading truck was used to block all entrances of the tunnel, and with the help of 80 police officers, it commanded the drivers to reroute.
ref: Dump trucks were used to block tube entrances and assistance of 80 police were on hand to direct motorists to detours.

src: 該市的替代路線環城高速公路並未傳出嚴重塞車的情況。
mt: The city's alternative route, the Ring City Highway, has not reported serious traffic congestion.
ref: There were no heavy traffic delays reported on the beltway, the city's alternate route.

src: 奈及利亞此前宣布，計畫在峰會舉行前一周加入非洲大陸自由貿易區協定 (AfCFTA)。
mt: Nigeria previously announced plans to join the African Continental Free Trade Area Agreement (AfCFTA) a week before the summit.
ref: Nigeria previously announced it planned to join the AfCFTA in the week leading up to the summit.

src: 非洲聯盟貿易及工業處長阿爾伯特·穆昌加 (Albert Muchanga) 宣布貝南共和國即將加入。
mt: Albert Muchanga, Director of Trade and Industry of the African Union, announced the coming of the Republic of Benin.
ref: AU trade and industry commissioner Albert Muchanga announced Benin was to join.

src: 該委員表示：「我們尚未在原產地規則和關稅減讓上取得協議， 但我們所建立的架構已足以讓我們在 2020 年 7 月 1 日開始進行交易」。
mt: The committee said, "We have not yet obtained an agreement on the rules of origin and tariff reductions, but the framework we have built is sufficient to allow us to start trading on July 1, 2020."
ref: The commissioner said, "We haven't yet agreed on rules of origin and tariff con[c]essions, but the framework we have is enough to start trading on July 1, 2020".

src: 雖然該站在先前的太空站任務中損失陀螺儀，但還是維持了其姿態直到太空漫步結束。
mt: Although the gyroscope was lost during the previous space station mission, it still maintained its posture until the end of the spacewalk.
ref: The station maintained its attitude, despite the loss of a gyroscope earlier in the space station mission, until the end of the spacewalk.

src: 據報導，焦立中和沙里波夫與姿態調整推進器保持安全距離。
mt: According to reports, Joli-Chyun and Shari-Pov maintain a safe distance from the attitude adjustment propulsion unit.
ref: Chiao and Sharipov reported being a safe distance from the attitude adjustment thrusters.

src: 俄羅斯的地面控制中心啟動了噴射口，接著太空站就重新恢復了正常姿態。
mt: Russia's ground control center activated the jet nozzle, and then the space station resumed normal posture.
ref: Russian ground control activated the jets and normal attitude of the station was regained.

src: 嫌犯在維吉尼亞遭到起訴，因為那裡是提告者，也就是網路服務供應商龍頭 AOL 的所在地。
mt: The suspect was charged in Virginia because it was the location of the Internet service provider AOL, the plaintiff.
ref: The case was prosecuted in Virginia because it is the home to the leading internet service provider AOL, the company who instigated the charges.

src: 自 2003 年頒布法規，遏止未經收信人許可寄發大量郵件（亦即垃圾郵件）至使用者信箱以來，這是第一次依該法規定罪。
mt: This is the first time a law has been imposed since the enactment of a law in 2003 to prevent the sending of large amounts of mail (i.e., spam) to users' mailboxes without the permission of the recipient.
ref: This is the first time a conviction has been gained using the legislation enacted in 2003 to curb bulk e-mail, aka spam, from unsolicited distribution into users mailboxes.

src: 21 歲的熱蘇斯於 2017 年 1 月從巴西的帕梅拉斯體育俱樂部加入了曼徹斯特城足球俱樂部，據傳報酬為 2700 萬英鎊。
mt: In January 2017, 21-year-old Jesús joined Manchester City Football Club from Palmeiras Sports Club in Brazil, reportedly paying £27 million.
ref: 21-year-old Jesus joined Manchester City last year in January 2017 from Brazilian club Palmeiras for a reported fee of £27 million.

src: 自此之後，這位巴西選手共為該球隊踢了 53 場球賽，進了 24 球。
mt: Since then, this Brazilian player has played 53 matches for the team and scored 24 goals.
ref: Since then, the Brazilian has featured in 53 matches for the club in all competitions and has scored 24 goals.

src: 李醫生也對土耳其出現的兒童無症狀感染 A (H5N1) 型禽流感病毒的報導表達關切。
mt: Dr. Lee also expressed concerns about reports of asymptomatic infection of the A(H5N1) avian influenza virus in children in Turkey.
ref: Dr. Lee also expressed his concern about reports that children in Turkey have now become infected with the A(H5N1) avian influenza virus without becoming ill.

src: 他指出，部分研究認為這種疾病必須先變得較不致命，才有可能造成全球大流行。
mt: He pointed out that some studies believe that this disease must first become less deadly before it can cause a global pandemic.
ref: Some studies suggest that the disease must become less lethal before it can cause a global epidemic, he noted.

src: 令人擔憂的是，仍有輕微流感症狀的病患可能會經由日常作息繼續傳染給更多的人。
mt: What's worrying is that patients with mild flu symptoms may continue to be transmitted to more people through their daily routine.
ref: There is concern that patients may continue to infect more people by going through their daily routines if the flu symptoms remain mild.

src: 蘇珊科曼乳癌基金會發言人雷斯莉‧昂表示，該組織新增規定，不得對正接受法律調查的組織贈予或貸予資金。
mt: A spokesperson for the Susan Coman Breast Cancer Foundation, Reslie Ang, said that the organization's new regulations prohibit or grant funding to organizations undergoing legal investigations.
ref: Leslie Aun, a spokesperson for the Komen Foundation, said the organization adopted a new rule that does not allow grants or funding to be awarded to organizations that are under legal investigation.

src: 由於國會議員克里夫‧斯特恩斯還在調查美國計劃生育聯盟支出及報銷其費用的方式，科曼的政策遂取消了美國計劃生育聯盟的資格。
mt: Due to Congressman Cliff Sterns' investigation into the U.S. Family Planning Association's expenditure and reimbursement of its costs, Coman's policy therefore cancelled the membership of the Family Planning Association in the United States.
ref: Komen's policy disqualified Planned Parenthood due to a pending investigation on how Planned Parenthood spends and reports its money that is being conducted by Representative Cliff Stearns.

src: 身為美國眾議院能源及貿易委員會的監督和調查小組委員會的主席，司坦斯正在調查納稅人的錢是否透過「計劃生育協會」被用來資助墮胎。
mt: As the chairman of the House Energy and Trade Committee's oversight and investigation subcommittee, Stans is investigating whether taxpayers' money is being used to fund abortion through the Family Planning Association.
ref: Stearns is investigating whether taxes are used to fund abortions through Planned Parenthood in his role as chairman of the Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee, which is under the umbrella of the House Energy and Commerce Committee.

src: 前麻薩諸塞州州長米特‧羅姆尼週二以超過 46% 的選票贏下佛羅里達共和黨總統初選。
mt: Former Massachusetts Governor Mitt Romney won the Republican presidential primaries on Tuesday with over 46% of the vote.
ref: Former Massachusetts governor Mitt Romney won the Florida Republican Party presidential primary election on Tuesday with over 46 percent of the vote.

src: 前美國眾議院​議長紐特‧金瑞契以 32% 的選票位居第二。
mt: Former U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Newt Kingrich finished second with 32 percent of the vote.
ref: Former U.S. Speaker of the House Newt Gingrich came in second with 32 percent.

src: 作為贏者全拿的州，佛羅里達州的五十名代表全數歸予羅姆尼，這使他成為共和黨提名的領先者。
mt: As the state with all wins, all fifty representatives from Florida were given to Romney, making him a leader in Republican nomination.
ref: As a winner-takes-all state, Florida awarded all fifty of its delegates to Romney, pushing him ahead as the front-runner for the Republican Party nomination.

src: 抗議活動的組織者表示，柏林、科隆、漢堡和漢諾威等德國城市約有 10 萬人參與。
mt: Organizers of the protests said that around 100,000 people participated in German cities such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg and Hanover.
ref: Organisers of the protest said about 100,000 people turned up in German cities such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, and Hanover.

src: 據警方估計，柏林約有 6,500 名抗議者。
mt: According to police estimates, there are approximately 6,500 protesters in Berlin.
ref: In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protestors.

src: 抗議活動還發生在巴黎、保加利亞的索菲亞、立陶宛的維爾紐斯、馬爾他的法勒他、愛沙尼亞的塔林以及蘇格蘭的愛丁堡和格拉斯哥等城市。
mt: Protests also took place in Paris, Bulgaria's Sofia, Lithuania's Vilnius, Malta's Fatta, Estonia's Tallinn and Scotland's Edinburgh and Glasgow.
ref: Protests also took place in Paris, Sofia in Bulgaria, Vilnius in Lithuania, Valetta in Malta, Tallinn in Estonia, and Edinburgh and Glasgow in Scotland.

src: 在倫敦，大約有 200 位民眾在部份版權持有商的辦公室外抗議。
mt: In London, about 200 people protested outside the offices of some copyright holders.
ref: In London, about 200 people protested outside some major copyright holders' offices.

src: 波蘭在上個月簽署了反仿冒貿易協定，並在國內引發大型抗議，導致波蘭政府決定暫不批准該協議。
mt: Poland signed an anti-counterfeiting trade agreement last month, sparking large-scale protests within the country, prompting the Polish government to decide not to approve it temporarily.
ref: Last month, there were major protests in Poland when that country signed ACTA, which has led to the Polish government deciding not to ratify the agreement, for now.

src: 拉脫維亞及斯洛伐克都推遲加入反仿冒貿易協定的程序。
mt: Both Latvia and Slovakia have postponed the process of joining the anti-counterfeiting trade agreement.
ref: Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA.

src: 動物解放組織和英國皇家防止虐待動物協會 (RSPCA) 再次呼籲，所有澳洲屠宰場中都要強制安裝閉路電視攝影機。
mt: The Animal Liberation Organisation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) have again called for the mandatory installation of closed-circuit television cameras at all slaughterhouses in Australia.
ref: Animal Liberation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) are again calling for the mandatory installation of CCTV cameras in all Australian abattoirs.

src: RSPCA 新南威爾斯州首席檢查員大衛‧歐山納西向 ABC 表示，澳洲應普遍執行對屠宰場的監控和與檢查。
mt: RSPCA New South Wales Chief Inspector David Osanaxi told ABC that Australia should generally monitor and inspect slaughterhouses.
ref: RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and inspections of abattoirs should be commonplace in Australia.

src: 「監視器一定會向這些養殖工作者傳達一個強烈訊息，也就是動物的福利是重中之重。」
mt: "The cameras will definitely convey a strong message to these fish farmers that animal welfare is of paramount importance."
ref: "The CCTV would certainly send a strong signal to those people working with animals that their welfare is of the highest priority."

src: 美國地質調查局的國際地震地圖顯示冰島過去一週都沒有發生地震。
mt: The International Seismic Map of the United States Geological Survey shows that there have been no earthquakes in Iceland over the past week.
ref: The United States Geological Survey international earthquake map showed no earthquakes in Iceland in the week prior.

src: 冰島氣象局亦表示海克拉火山地區在過去 48 小時無地震活動。
mt: The Iceland Meteorological Service also stated that there was no seismic activity in the Häkla volcano area over the past 48 hours.
ref: The Icelandic Meteorological Office also reported no earthquake activity in the Hekla area in the past 48 hours.

src: 引發狀態改變的明顯地震活動發生於 3 月 10 日，位置在火山頂端火山口的東北側。
mt: A significant seismic activity that triggered a state change occurred on March 10, located northeast of the volcano's top volcanic crater.
ref: The significant earthquake activity resulting in the phase change had took place on March 10 on the northeast side of the volcano's summit caldera.

src: 有人說山腳下出現與任何火山活動皆無關的烏雲據。
mt: Some say that there are clouds at the foot of a mountain that have nothing to do with any volcanic activity.
ref: Dark clouds unrelated to any volcanic activity were reported at the base of the mountain.

src: 眼前所見的雲可能造成混淆，不確定是否真的發生火山爆發。
mt: The clouds seen in front of us may cause confusion, and it is uncertain whether volcanic eruptions actually occurred.
ref: The clouds presented the potential for confusion as to whether an actual eruption had taken place.

src: 魯諾號拋錨時，船上有 120 到 160 立方公尺的燃料，狂風和巨浪將船推進了防波堤。
mt: When the Runo broke down, there were 120 to 160 cubic meters of fuel on board, and strong winds and giant waves pushed the ship into the breakwater.
ref: The Luno had 120–160 cubic metres of fuel aboard when it broke down and high winds and waves pushed it into the breakwater.

src: 直升機救出了十二名船員，只有一人鼻骨骨折。
mt: Twelve crew members were rescued by a helicopter, with only one broken nose.
ref: Helicopters rescued the twelve crewmembers and the only injury was a broken nose.

src: 那艘 100 公尺的輪船正在前往運載一批其經常運載的肥料途中，而主管人員原本害怕它會灑出許多。
mt: The 100-meter ship was on its way to transport a batch of fertilizer it often carried, and the management personnel were originally afraid it would spill many.
ref: The 100-metre ship was en route to pick up its usual fertiliser cargo and initially officials feared the vessel could spill a load.

src: 憲法修正案之提案已在 2011 年由兩院通過。
mt: The constitutional amendment was passed by both houses in 2011.
ref: The proposed amendment already passed both houses in 2011.

src: 本立法會期對該修正案進行修正，先經眾議院刪除第二條文，參議院再於本周一通過相似版本。
mt: This legislative session revised the amendment, first through the House of Representatives to delete the second clause, and then the Senate passed a similar version on Monday.
ref: A change was made this legislative session when the second sentence was deleted first by the House of Representatives and then was passed in a similar form by the Senate Monday.

src: 禁止同性民事結合的提議經第二次宣判失敗，有可能開啟未來同性民事結合之門。
mt: The proposal to prohibit same-sex civil unions failed after a second judgment, and may open the door to future same-sex civil unions.
ref: The failure of the second sentence, which proposes to ban same-sex civil unions, could possibly open the door for civil unions in the future.

src: 經此程序之後，眾議院聯合決議 3 將在 2015 或 2016 年由下屆民選立法機構重新審查，以持續修法。
mt: Following this procedure, the House of Representatives Joint Resolution 3 will be re-examined by the next elected legislative body in 2015 or 2016 to continue amending the law.
ref: Following the process, HJR-3 will be reviewed again by the next elected legislature in either 2015 or 2016 to remain in process.

src: 沃提爾執導筒之外的成就包括在 1973 年絕食抗議所謂的政治審查。
mt: The achievements beyond Watil's direction include the so-called political censorship of hunger strikes in 1973.
ref: Vautier's achievements outside of directing include a hunger strike in 1973 against what he viewed as political censorship.

src: 法國法律更改了。他的社運史從他十五歲於第二次世界大戰時加入了法國抵抗運動開始。
mt: French law changed. His social movement began when he joined the French Resistance at the age of 15 during World War II.
ref: French law was changed. His activism went back to age 15 when he joined the French Resistance during World War II.

src: 他在 1998 年的一本書中記錄了自己的一生。
mt: He wrote a book about his life in 1998.
ref: He documented himself in a 1998 book.

src: 他在 1960 年代返回剛獨立的阿爾及利亞，教授電影導演。
mt: He returned to newly independent Algeria in the 1960s, teaching film directors.
ref: In the 1960s he headed back to newly-independent Algeria to teach film directing.

src: 日本柔道選手，也是兩屆奧運金牌得主，齊藤仁 (Hitoshi Saito) 去世，時年 54 歲。
mt: Japanese judoka and two-time Olympic gold medalist, Hitoshi Saito, died at the age of 54.
ref: Japanese judoka Hitoshi Saito, winner of two Olympic gold medals, has died at the age of 54.

src: 公布的死因為肝內膽管癌。
mt: The cause of death was announced as bile duct cancer.
ref: The cause of death was announced as intrahepatic bile duct cancer.

src: 本週二他在大阪辭世。
mt: He died in Osaka this Tuesday.
ref: He died in Osaka on Tuesday.

src: 除了前奧運會和世界冠軍的身份之外，齋藤在去世前還擔任全日本柔道連盟培訓委員會的主席。
mt: In addition to his former Olympic and world champion identity, Saito served as the chairman of the All Japan Judo Federation Training Committee before his death.
ref: As well as a former Olympic and World champion, Saito was the All Japan Judo Federation training committee chairman at the time of his death.

src: 為了慶祝去年舉行婚禮的伴侶結婚滿一週年，至少有 100 位民眾參加了派對。
mt: To celebrate last year's wedding anniversary, at least 100 people attended the party.
ref: At least 100 people had attended the party, in order to celebrate the first anniversary of a couple whose wedding was held last year.

src: 官員們表示，原訂於幾日之後舉辦正式的週年紀念活動。
mt: Officials said that a formal anniversary event was scheduled to be held a few days later.
ref: A formal anniversary event was scheduled for a later date, officials said.

src: 這對夫妻在一年前於德州結婚，當時是到水牛城與親友慶祝。
mt: The couple got married a year ago in Texas, when they were celebrating at Buffalo with their friends and family.
ref: The couple had married in Texas one year ago and came to Buffalo to celebrate with friends and relatives.

src: 那名 30 歲、生於水牛城的丈夫，是在槍擊案中被殺的四名死者之一，但她的妻子並未受傷。
mt: The 30-year-old husband, born in Buffalo, was one of four killed in the shooting, but her wife was not injured.
ref: The 30-year-old husband, who was born in Buffalo, was one of the four killed in the shooting, but his wife was not hurt.

src: 范浩揚是眾人皆知但充滿爭議的英語補教老師，他曾任教於現代教育及英皇教育，自稱生涯顛峰期曾教過 9,000 名學生。
mt: Fan Haoyang is a well-known but controversial English tutor, who has taught modern education and English monarch education, claiming to have taught 9,000 students at the peak of his career.
ref: Karno is a well-known but controversial English tutor who taught under Modern Education and King's Glory who claimed to have 9,000 students at the peak of his career.

src: 他在筆記中使用了某些家長視為髒話的字眼，據說他在課堂上也會講粗話。
mt: He used some words considered dirty by parents in his notes, and it is said that he also used profanity in class.
ref: In his notes he used words which some parents considered coarse, and he reportedly used profanity in class.

src: 現代教育補習社指控他謊稱自己為該社之首席英文老師，並在未獲授權的情況下在公車上刊登大型廣告。
mt: Modern Education Supplementary Association accused him of lying about himself as the company's chief English teacher, and published a large advertisement on the bus without authorization.
ref: Modern Education accused him of printing large advertisements on buses without authorisation and lying by saying that he was the chief English tutor.

src: 他之前也被控侵犯版權，但沒有被起訴。
mt: He was also charged with copyright infringement, but was not charged.
ref: He has also been accused previously of copyright infringement, but was not charged.

src: 他以前的學生表示：「他在課堂上會用俚語，做筆記教我們約會技巧，他跟學生亦師亦友。」
mt: His former students said, "He uses slang in class to take notes and teach us dating techniques, and he is also a teacher and friend to the students."
ref: A former student said that he 'used slang in class, taught dating skills in notes, and was just like the students' friend.'

src: 過去三十年中，儘管中國官方仍宣稱他們是共產主義國家，但卻已發展出市場經濟。
mt: Over the past thirty years, although Chinese officials have still claimed to be communist countries, they have developed a market economy.
ref: During the last three decades, despite officially remaining a communist state, China has developed a market economy.

src: 首次經濟改革是在鄧小平的帶領之下進行。
mt: The first economic reform was carried out under Deng Xiaoping's leadership.
ref: The first economic reforms were made under the leadership of Deng Xiaoping.

src: 自此之後，中國的經濟規模成長了 90 倍。
mt: Since then, China's economic scale has grown by 90 times.
ref: Since then, China's economic size has grown by 90 times.

src: 去年中國汽車的出口量首次超越德國，也超越美國成為該產業最大的市場。
mt: Last year, China's automobile exports surpassed Germany for the first time, and surpassed the United States to become the largest market in the industry.
ref: For the first time, last year China exported more cars than Germany and surpassed the United States as the biggest market for this industry.

src: 中國的 GDP 在 20 年之內就可能超過美國。
mt: China's GDP could surpass that of the United States in 20 years.
ref: China's GDP could be larger than the United States within two decades.

src: 熱帶低氣壓丹妮爾，是 2010 年大西洋颶風季第四個獲得命名的風暴，於大西洋東部形成。
mt: Tropical Depression Danielle was the fourth named storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, forming in the eastern part of the Atlantic Ocean.
ref: Tropical Storm Danielle, fourth named storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, has formed in the eastern Atlantic Ocean.

src: 這場颶風距離佛羅里達州邁阿密約三千英里，最大持續風速是每小時 40 英里（每小時 64 公里）。
mt: This hurricane is approximately 3,000 miles from Miami, Florida, with a maximum sustained wind speed of 40 miles per hour (64 km/h).
ref: The storm, located approximately 3,000 miles from Miami, Florida, has maximum sustained winds of 40 mph (64 kph).

src: 美國國家颶風中心的科學家預測熱帶風暴丹妮爾會在周三增強為颶風。
mt: Scientists from the National Hurricane Center predict that Tropical Storm Danielle will intensify into a hurricane on Wednesday.
ref: Scientists at the National Hurricane Center predict that Danielle will strengthen to a hurricane by Wednesday.

src: 預計暴風雨還要很久才會登陸，會對美國或加勒比海地區造成多大的影響還很難說。
mt: It is expected that the storm will take a long time to land, and its impact on the United States or the Caribbean region is still difficult to say.
ref: As the storm is far from landfall, it remains difficult to assess potential impact to the United States or Caribbean.

src: 波貝克出生於克羅埃西亞的首都薩格勒布，在為貝爾格萊德游擊隊效力時成名。
mt: Born in Croatia's capital Zagreb, he became famous while serving with the Belgrade guerrillas.
ref: Born in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, Bobek gained fame while playing for Partizan Belgrade.

src: 他在 1945 年加入該隊，並一直待到 1958 年。
mt: He joined the team in 1945 and remained there until 1958.
ref: He joined them in 1945 and stayed until 1958.

src: 他在該隊期間，共計出賽 468 次，獲得 403 分。
mt: He played a total of 468 times and scored 403 points during his time with the team.
ref: During his time with the team, he scored 403 goals in 468 appearances.

src: 博貝克在球隊中的出場數與進球數居冠。
mt: Bobeck led the team in terms of appearances and goals.
ref: No one else has ever made more appearances or scored more goals for the club than Bobek.

src: 1995 年，他獲選為游擊隊足球俱樂部的史上最佳球員。
mt: In 1995, he was named the best player in the history of guerrilla football clubs.
ref: In 1995 he was voted the best player in Partizan's history.

src: 慶祝活動以世界知名的太陽馬戲團特別演出揭開序幕。
mt: The celebration kicked off with a world-renowned Cirque du Soleil special performance.
ref: The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil.

src: 緊接著是伊斯坦堡國家交響樂團 (Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra) —一支軍樂隊，以及歌手法蒂赫·埃爾科克 (Fatih Erkoç) 和穆斯呂姆·古爾斯 (Müslüm Gürses)。
mt: Following is the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a military band and singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses.
ref: It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses.

src: 接著是土耳其旋轉舞表演。
mt: Following is a Turkish rotating dance performance.
ref: Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage.

src: 土耳其天后蘇珊‧雅克蘇與義大利男高音亞歷山大‧沙費納和希臘歌手哈麗絲‧亞力克西烏同臺演出。
mt: Turkish queen Susan Yaxu performed with Italian baritone Alexander Saffron and Greek singer Harris Aleksei.
ref: Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou.

src: 在結尾，土耳其舞蹈團體「安納托利亞之火」 表演了「特洛伊」這個戲碼。
mt: At the end, the Turkish dance group Anatolia's Fire performed the play Troy.
ref: To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show "Troy".

src: 13 歲的摩托車賽車手彼得·倫茨，在印第安納波利斯賽車場的一場車禍中喪生。
mt: Peter Lentz, a 13-year-old motorcycle racer, died in a car accident at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.
ref: Peter Lenz, a 13-year-old motorcycle racer, has died after being involved in a crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.

src: 蘭茲在熱身圈時摔車，被同為選手的賽維爾‧札亞特撞上。
mt: Lanz fell off his car while warm-up, and was hit by Sevier Zayat, also a player.
ref: While on his warm-up lap, Lenz fell off his bike, and was then struck by fellow racer Xavier Zayat.

src: 賽道現場的醫護人員立刻為他急救，並將他送往當地醫院，後來他於該院逝世。
mt: Medical personnel on the track immediately provided him with emergency treatment and sent him to a local hospital, where he later died.
ref: He was immediately attended to by the on-track medical staff and transported to a local hospital where he later died.

src: 扎耶特並未因事故受傷。
mt: Zayette was not injured by the accident.
ref: Zayat was unhurt in the accident.

src: 談到全球金融狀況時，薩巴德洛繼續說道：「金融系統是經濟的一部份，而且是很重要的一部份。」
mt: Speaking of the global financial situation, Sabadell continues, “The financial system is part of the economy and an important part of it.”
ref: Regarding the global financial situation, Zapatero continued by saying that "the financial system is a part of the economy, a crucial part.

src: 我們經歷了長達一年的金融危機，而最近兩個月是情況最為嚴峻的時期，我認為金融市場現在已經開始復甦了。」
mt: We've been through a year-long financial crisis, and the last two months have been the most severe, and I think the financial market is now starting to recover. "
ref: We have a year-long financial crisis, which has had its most acute moment in the past two months, and I think now the financial markets are beginning to recover."

src: 裸體新聞上週宣布它將推出三個新廣播節目，大幅增加其新聞報導的國際語言授權。
mt: Nudist News announced last week that it will launch three new radio programs, significantly increasing its international language licensing of news coverage.
ref: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts.

src: 這個全球性組織已有英語及日語報導，現在要在電視、網路和行動裝置上推出西班牙語、義大利語和韓語節目。
mt: This global organization has been reported in English and Japanese, and now plans to launch Spanish, Italian, and Korean programs on television, the Internet, and mobile devices.
ref: Already reporting in English and Japanese, the global organization is launching Spanish, Italian, and Korean-language programs, for television, the web, and mobile devices.

src: 「我很幸運地毫髮無傷，但我目睹了大家試著打破窗戶逃生的恐怖景象。」
mt: “I was lucky to be unscathed, but I saw the horrors of people trying to break the window and escape.”
ref: "Luckily nothing happened to me, but I saw a macabre scene, as people tried to break windows in order to get out.

src: 人們用椅子砸玻璃，但窗戶堅不可破。
mt: People use chairs to smash glass, but the windows are impenetrable.
ref: People were hitting the panes with chairs, but the windows were unbreakable.

src: 其中一塊玻璃終於破了，他們開始從窗戶逃出。」倖存者弗朗西斯克·科瓦爾 (Franciszek Kowal) 說。
mt: One of the pieces of glass finally broke, and they began to escape through the window, "says survivor Franciszek Kowal.
ref: One of the panes finally broke, and they started to get out by the window," said survivor Franciszek Kowal.

src: 星星會發出光和熱，這是因為氫原子會在融合形成質量更重的元素時產生能量。
mt: Stars emit light and heat because hydrogen atoms produce energy when they fuse to form heavier elements.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements.

src: 科學家正努力打造一種可透過相同方式產生能源的反應器。
mt: Scientists are working to create a reactor that can generate energy in the same way.
ref: Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way.

src: 然而，這是一道艱澀的難題，在我們看到實用的核子反應器建造之前，需要花上許多年才能解決。
mt: However, this is a difficult problem, and it took many years to solve before we saw the practical nuclear reactors being built.
ref: This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: 鋼針會浮在水面上是因為表面張力。
mt: Steel needles float on water surface because of surface tension.
ref: The steel needle floats on top of the water because of surface tension.

src: 發生表面張力是因為水面的分子會強烈吸引彼此，強度超過上方的空氣分子。
mt: The surface tension occurs because the molecules on the water surface strongly attract each other, with strength exceeding that of the air molecules above.
ref: Surface tension happens because the water molecules at the surface of the water are strongly attracted to each other more than they are to the air molecules above them.

src: 水分子在水面上形成一層隱形的膜，讓針等物體能浮在水上。
mt: Water molecules form a layer of invisible membrane on the surface of the water, allowing objects such as needles to float on the water.
ref: The water molecules make an invisible skin on the water’s surface that allows things like the needle to float on top of the water.

src: 現代溜冰鞋的冰刀有雙重刀刃，刀刃間有一處凹陷。雙重刀刃即使在傾斜時，也能更有效地抓住冰面。
mt: The modern ice skates have a double-edged blade with a concave edge between the blades. A double-edged blade can grab the ice more effectively even when leaning.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted.

src: 由於冰刀底部略有弧度，當冰刀往某側傾斜時，其接觸冰面的邊緣亦呈彎曲。
mt: Due to the slightly curved bottom of the ice knife, when the ice knife is tilted towards a certain side, its edge on the ice surface is also curved.
ref: Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves.

src: 這會使溜冰者轉向。如果溜冰鞋右傾，溜冰者會向右轉，如果左傾就會向左轉。
mt: This causes the skater to turn. If the skate is leaned right, the skater will turn right, and if left, it will turn left.
ref: This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: 若要恢復到之前的能階，它們必須排放從光線中獲得的額外能量。
mt: To recover to the previous energy level, they must emit additional energy obtained from light.
ref: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light.

src: 他們透過發出稱為「光子」的微粒子來完成。
mt: They accomplish this by emitting a particle called a "photon".
ref: They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a "photon".

src: 科學家稱此過程為「刺激輻射排放」，因為原子會受到亮光刺激，放射出光子，而光線就是一種輻射。
mt: Scientists call this process "stimulating radiation emission," because atoms are stimulated by bright light to emit photons, and light is a kind of radiation.
ref: Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation.

src: 接下來是原子發射光子的圖片。當然，實際上的光子比圖片中小很多。
mt: And then there's an image of atoms emitting photons. And of course, the actual photons are much smaller than they are in the picture.
ref: The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture.

src: 光子甚至比構成原子的粒子還小！
mt: Photons are even smaller than the particles that make up atoms!
ref: Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!

src: 在通電數百小時之後，燈泡中的鎢絲最終會燒壞，燈泡也不再發亮。
mt: After being powered on for hundreds of hours, the tungsten filament in the light bulb will eventually burn out and the light bulb will no longer glow.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works.

src: 這時就需要更換燈泡了。更換燈泡時必須非常小心。
mt: You need to change the light bulb at this time. You must be very careful when changing the light bulb.
ref: The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb.

src: 首先，必須關閉燈具開關，或拔掉電源線。
mt: First, you must turn off the light switch or unplug the power cord.
ref: First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected.

src: 這是因為如果您在燈泡的金屬底座仍有部份插在插座上時，觸碰到插座內部或其金屬底座，則流入燈泡金屬部份插座的電流，會讓您嚴重觸電。
mt: This is because if you are still stuck in the metal base of the light bulb on the socket and touch the inside of the socket or its metal base, the current flowing into the metal part of the light bulb socket will cause you to have a serious electric shock.
ref: This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: 循環系統中的主要器官是心臟，它將血液輸送至全身。
mt: The main organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which transports blood throughout the body.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood.

src: 血液從稱為動脈的血管中流出心臟，然後經由稱為靜脈的血管流回心臟。最細小的血管稱為微血管。
mt: The blood flows out of a blood vessel called an artery, and then through a vessel called a vein, it flows back to the heart. The smallest blood vessel is called a capillaries.
ref: Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: 三角龍的牙齒不僅能咬碎樹葉，甚至連堅硬的樹枝和樹根也能搞定。
mt: The teeth of the Triceratops not only can crush leaves, but also hard branches and roots.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots.

src: 部分科學家認為三角龍會吃蘇鐵屬植物，即白堊紀常見的一種植物。
mt: Some scientists believe that Triceratops will eat a plant of the genus Scutellaria, which was a common plant in the Cretaceous period.
ref: Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous.

src: 這些植物看起來像是小型的棕櫚樹，樹冠有銳利尖刺形葉片。
mt: These plants look like small palm trees, with sharp pointed thorn-shaped leaves on the canopy.
ref: These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves.

src: 三角龍會在食用樹幹之前，用牠強而有力的喙扯下樹葉。
mt: Triceratops will use its powerful beak to tear down leaves before eating tree trunks.
ref: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk.

src: 其他科學家主張這些植物有劇毒，因此恐龍不可能吃下它們，雖然現在樹懶和其他如鸚鵡（恐龍的後代）等動物可以吃有毒的葉子或果實。
mt: Other scientists advocate that these plants are highly toxic, so dinosaurs cannot eat them, although now sloths and other animals such as parrots (descendants of dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruits.
ref: Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: 艾奧的重力有多大 對我有多少影響？如果您站在艾奧的地面上，您的體重會比您在地球上的體重輕。
mt: How much effect does Aeo's gravity have on me? If you're standing on Aeo's ground, you're lighter than you are on Earth.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth.

src: 在地球上體重 200 磅（ 90 公斤）的人，到了木衛一上會變成 36 磅（ 16 公斤）。所以說，地心引力對你的拉力當然比較小。
mt: People who weigh 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth will turn 36 pounds (16 kg) on Io. So, gravity naturally pulls you less.
ref: A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: 太陽沒有像地球一樣，可以立於其上的地殼。太陽是由氣體、火和電漿組成的。
mt: The Sun does not have an Earth-like crust on it. The Sun is composed of gas, fire and plasma.
ref: The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma.

src: 離太陽中心越遠，氣體就越稀薄。
mt: The farther away from the sun's center, the thinner the gas is.
ref: The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun.

src: 我們看見的太陽外層稱為「photosphere」，意即「光球」。
mt: The outer layer of the sun that we see is called a "photosphere", which means "light ball".
ref: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light".

src: 大約三千年後，1610 年義大利天文學家伽利略·伽利萊使用望遠鏡觀察到金星和月亮一樣有圓缺變化。
mt: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe the circular variation of Venus and the Moon.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does.

src: 金星（或月球）之所以有盈虧，是因為僅有面對太陽的那一面被照亮。金星盈虧證實了哥白尼的理論──行星繞著太陽旋轉。
mt: Venus (or the Moon) is profitable because only the face of the Sun is illuminated. Venus profit and loss confirms Copernicus’ theory that planets revolve around the Sun.
ref: Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun.

src: 接著在幾年後的 1639 年，一名名為傑雷米亞·霍羅克斯的天文學家觀察到了金星凌日。
mt: In 1639, a few years later, an astronomer named Jeremya Horrox observed the transit of Venus.
ref: Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: 英格蘭在重新征服丹麥區之後，經歷了一段長時間的和平。
mt: England experienced a long period of peace after the re-conquering of Denmark.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw.

src: 然而，埃塞爾雷德 (Ethelred) 在 991 年面臨了一支維京艦隊，其規模是一個世紀前古思倫 (Guthrum) 的艦隊以來最龐大的艦隊。
mt: However, Ethelred faced a Viking fleet in 991, its scale being the largest fleet since Guthrum's fleet a century ago.
ref: However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier.

src: 這支艦隊由奧拉夫·特里格維松率領，這名雄心勃勃的挪威人想要從丹麥手中奪回自己的國家。
mt: This fleet was led by Olaf Trigvesson, an ambitious Norwegian who wanted to regain his country from Denmark.
ref: This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination.

src: 歷經一開始的軍事挫敗後，埃塞爾雷德得以和奧拉夫簽訂條款，奧拉夫憑著一連串的成功，重返挪威，試圖奪回他的王國。
mt: After experiencing initial military defeat, Esselred was able to sign a treaty with Olaf, and Olaf returned to Norway with a series of successes in an attempt to regain his kingdom.
ref: After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: 諺文是唯一一個在日常使用中特意發明的字母。其字母是在世宗年間（1418-1450 年）於 1444 年所發明。
mt: The proverb is the only one that was invented in everyday use. It was invented in 1444 during the reign of the King (1418-1450).
ref: Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450).

src: 朝鮮王朝的第四任國王是世宗大王，他是最受景仰的國王之一。
mt: The fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty was Sejong King, one of the most revered kings.
ref: King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded.

src: 他最初將韓文字母命名為「訓民正音」，意思是「教導人民的正確聲音」。
mt: He initially named the Korean alphabet as "Training the Right Voice of the People", meaning "teaching the correct sound of the people".
ref: He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people".

src: 有許多關於梵文起源的理論。其中之一為雅利安人從西方遷徙至印度時帶入了原本使用的語言。
mt: There are many theories about the origins of Sanskrit. One of them is that the Aryans migrated from the West to India and brought in the language they originally used.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them.

src: 梵語是一種古老語言，歷史可媲美歐洲的拉丁語。
mt: Sanskrit is an ancient language, with a history comparable to that of Latin in Europe.
ref: Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe.

src: 世界上已知最早的書是以梵文撰寫。在完成奧義書後，梵文因階級制度而逐漸消亡。
mt: The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the completion of the Book of Oji, the Sanskrit gradually disappeared due to the class system.
ref: The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy.

src: 梵語是一種非常複雜又豐富的語言，也是印度許多種現代語言的來源，好比拉丁語也是法語和西班牙語等歐洲語言之源頭一樣。
mt: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, also the source of many modern languages in India, like Latin being the source of French and Spanish and other European languages.
ref: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: 征討法國的戰爭結束後，德國開始準備入侵不列顛群島。
mt: After the war to conquer France ended, Germany began preparing to invade the British Isles.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain.

src: 德國給那次攻擊取了「海獅計畫」的代號。英國軍隊從敦克爾克撤退時，大多數的重型武器和補給品都沒了，所以那時的英軍相當虛弱。
mt: Germany gave the attack the codename "The Sea Lion Plan." When British troops retreated from Dunkirk, most of the heavy weapons and supplies were gone, so the British were very weak at the time.
ref: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak.

src: 但皇家海軍仍比德國海軍 (Kriegsmarine) 強大許多，並可摧毀任何欲入侵英吉利海峽的艦隊。
mt: However, the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (Kriegsmarine) and could destroy any fleet that wanted to invade the English Channel.
ref: But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel.

src: 然而，很少皇家海軍軍艦已易受攻擊的路線附近為基地，因為艦隊司令們害怕他們會被德軍的空襲擊沉。
mt: However, few Royal Navy warships have been easily attacked on their bases near the route, because the fleet commanders were afraid they would be sunk by German air attacks.
ref: However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: 我們先解釋一下義大利的計畫。義大利主要是德國和日本的「小跟班」。
mt: Let's start by explaining the Italian plan: Italy is primarily a "small follow-up" for Germany and Japan.
ref: Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan.

src: 其陸軍及海軍較弱，雖然戰爭開始前不久才剛打造四艘新艦。
mt: Its army and navy are relatively weak, although four new ships were built just before the war began.
ref: It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war.

src: 義大利的主要目標是非洲國家。為了攻佔那些國家，他們需有軍隊可用的跳板，使軍隊能夠渡過地中海並侵略非洲。
mt: Italy’s primary objective is to be African nations. To capture those countries, they need a springboard of troops available to enable them to cross the Mediterranean and invade Africa.
ref: Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa.

src: 為此，他們必須除掉英國在埃及的基地和船隻，除了這些行動之外，義大利戰艦不該涉及其他事情。
mt: In order to do this, they must eliminate British bases and ships in Egypt, except for these actions, Italian warships should not be involved in other things.
ref: For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else.

src: 再來是日本，日本和英國一樣是島國。
mt: Then Japan, like Britain, is an island nation.
ref: Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain.

src: 潛水艇是專門用於水下行進的船隻，可以延長在水下停留的時間。
mt: Submarines are specialized for underwater movement, and can extend the time of stay underwater.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time.

src: 第一次和第二次世界大戰都使用了潛水艇。當時潛水艇移動得很慢，而且射程極有限。
mt: Submarines were used during both World War I and World War II. At that time, the submarine moved very slowly and had a very limited range.
ref: Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range.

src: 在戰爭剛開始時，它們大多在海面上移動，但隨著雷達的研發開始和變得越來越精確後，潛水艇被迫潛入水中以避免被看見。
mt: At the beginning of the war, they were mostly moving on the sea surface, but with the development of radar and becoming increasingly precise, submarines were forced to dive into the water to avoid being seen.
ref: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen.

src: 德國潛水艇稱為「U 艇」。德國人非常擅長駕駛和操控他們的潛水艇。
mt: The German submarine is known as the U-boat. The Germans are very good at piloting and operating their submarines.
ref: German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines.

src: 由於德國人在潛水艇方面的成功，戰後人們對德國人擁有太多潛水艇感到不信任。
mt: Due to the success of Germans in submarines, people after the war felt distrustful of Germans having too many submarines.
ref: Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: 沒錯！有時也被暱稱「圖坦王」或「少年法老」的圖坦卡門，是現代最著名的古埃及法老之一。
mt: Yes! Sometimes also known as "King Tutankhamun" or "Young Pharaoh", Tutankhamun is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian pharaohs in modern times.
ref: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times.

src: 有趣的是，他在古代並不是多重要的人士，也沒有被記錄在大多數古代國王的名單上。
mt: Interestingly, he was not a very important person in ancient times and was not recorded on the list of most ancient kings.
ref: Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists.

src: 然而，他的墳墓在 1922 年被發現了，這使他成為名人。過去的許多墳墓都曾被盜過，但這座墳墓卻絲毫未被打擾。
mt: However, his grave was discovered in 1922, making him a celebrity. Many of his graves have been looted in the past, but this tomb has not been disturbed at all.
ref: However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed.

src: 大多數和圖坦卡門一起下葬的物件都保存良好，包含用貴金屬與稀有寶石製作的上千個工藝品。
mt: Most objects buried with Tutankhamun are well-preserved, including over a thousand handicrafts made of precious metals and rare gems.
ref: Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones.

src: 幅條輪的發明讓亞述人的馬車更輕、更快，且更能跑贏士兵與其他馬車。
mt: The invention of the wide wheel made Assyrians' carriages lighter and faster, and more able to win over soldiers and other carriages.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots.

src: 致命的十字弓所射出的箭可穿透敵軍身上的盔甲。約在西元前 1 千年，亞述人導入了史上第一支騎兵部隊。
mt: Deadly crossbow arrows pierce enemy armor. Around 1000 BC, the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry unit in history.
ref: Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry.

src: 騎兵是指一騎著馬作戰的軍隊。當時尚未發明馬鞍，因此亞述騎兵是騎在毫無裝備的馬背上作戰。
mt: Cavalry refers to an army that fights on horseback. The saddle was not yet invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fights on unarmed horseback.
ref: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: 我們認識許多希臘政治家、科學家和藝術家；此文化中最知名的人物也許是傳奇的失明詩人—荷馬，他創作了希臘兩大傑作：史詩《伊利亞德》和《奧德賽》。
mt: We know many Greek politicians, scientists and artists; perhaps the most famous person in this culture is the legendary blind poet Homer, who created two great works of Greece: the epics Iliad and Odyssey.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey.

src: 蘇弗克里茲和亞里斯多芬至今依然是備受歡迎的劇作家，他們的劇本被視為最偉大的世界文學作品之一。
mt: Sufritz and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights today, their scripts being considered one of the greatest literary works in the world.
ref: Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature.

src: 另一個有名的希臘人是數學家畢達哥拉斯，主要以直角三角形各邊關係的知名定理為人所知。
mt: Another famous Greek is the mathematician Pythagoras, who is known for his famous theorems on the relationships between the sides of a right triangle.
ref: Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: 對於說印地語的人數有許多不同的估計；印地語估計是世界上使用人口第二至第四大的語言。
mt: There are many different estimates of the number of people who speak Hindi; Hindi is estimated to be the second to fourth most spoken language in the world.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world.

src: 持母語者的數量，會根據是否算入近似方言的使用者數量而改變。
mt: The number of native speakers will change depending on whether they are counted as similar to the number of speakers in a dialect.
ref: The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted.

src: 使用該語言的人口，估計約有 3.4 億至 5 億人，並且多達 8 億人能了解該語言。
mt: The population using this language is estimated to be around 340-500 million people, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language.
ref: Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language.

src: 印度語和烏爾都語在語彙上非常相像，但書寫起來很不一樣；在日常的對話中，講這兩種語言的人通常能互相了解。
mt: In terms of vocabulary, Hindi and Urdu are very similar, but written differently; in everyday conversation, people who speak these two languages usually understand each other.
ref: Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: 15 世紀左右，愛沙尼亞北部深受德國文化影響。
mt: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was deeply influenced by German culture.
ref: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany.

src: 有些德國修士想讓本地人民更接近上帝，因此發明了愛沙尼亞文字。
mt: Some German monks wanted to bring the local people closer to God, so they invented the Estonian script.
ref: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language.

src: "它源自於德語字母，並增加了一個 "Õ/õ" 字符。""
mt: "It originates from the German alphabet and adds a  ⁇ / ⁇  character."
ref: It was based on the German alphabet and one character "Õ/õ" was added.

src: 隨著時間的推移，許多從德語借來的詞也融在一起。這是啟蒙的開端。
mt: As time went by, many borrowed words from German also melted together. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
ref: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment.

src: 傳統上，王位繼承人完成學業之後會直接從軍。
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would directly graduate from the military after completing his studies.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school.

src: 然而，查爾斯卻去劍橋的三一學院，修習人類學和考古學，後來又修了歷史，得到了 2:2（二等二級學位）。
mt: However, Charles went to Cambridge's Trinity College to study anthropology and archaeology, later also studied history, obtaining a 2:2 (second-class second-class degree).
ref: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree).

src: 查爾斯是首位被授予學位的英國王室成員。
mt: Charles was the first member of the British royal family to be granted a degree.
ref: Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: 歐洲土耳其 (位於巴爾幹半島的東色雷斯，或稱魯米利亞) 占其國家面積 3%。
mt: Turkey in Europe (located on the Balkan Peninsula's East Thrace, also known as Rumelia) covers an area of 3% of its country.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country.

src: 土耳其的領土長 1,600 多公里（1,000 英里），寬 800 公里（500 英里），大致上呈現一個矩形形狀。
mt: Turkey's territory is over 1,600 kilometers (1,000 miles) long and 800 kilometers (500 miles) wide, roughly in a rectangular shape.
ref: The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape.

src: 土耳其的面積，連同湖泊在內，占 783,562 平方公里（300,948 平方英里），其中 755,688 平方公里（291,773 平方英里）在亞洲西南部，23,764 平方公里（9,174 平方英里）在歐洲。
mt: Turkey covers an area of 783,562 km2 (300,948 sq mi), including lakes, with 755,688 km2 (291,773 sq mi) in the southwest of Asia and 23,764 km2 (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.
ref: Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.

src: 土耳其的面積使它成為世界第 37 大的國家，與法國本土加上英國面積差不多大小。
mt: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th largest country, roughly the same size as France and Britain.
ref: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined.

src: 土耳其三面環海：西邊的愛琴海﹑北邊的黑海以及南邊的地中海。
mt: Turkey is surrounded by sea on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
ref: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: 盧森堡的歷史悠久，但 1839 年後才獨立 。
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but it did not become independent until 1839.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839.

src: 現今，比利時的部分地區在過去曾是盧森堡的一部分，但在 1830 年代的比利時革命之後變成比利時。
mt: Today, parts of Belgium were once part of Luxembourg in the past, but after the 1830s Belgian Revolution became Belgium.
ref: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.

src: 盧森堡一直試圖保持中立國的立場，但在第一次和第二次世界大戰時皆被德國佔領。
mt: Luxembourg has always attempted to maintain a neutral country's position, but was occupied by Germany during both the first and World War II.
ref: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany.

src: 1957 年，盧森堡成為了如今被稱為歐洲聯盟的組織的創始成員之一。
mt: In 1957, Luxembourg became one of the founding members of what is now known as the European Union.
ref: In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: 杜克耶堡是位於帕羅區北方（Phondey 村內）的一個堡壘與佛寺廢墟。
mt: Dukee Fort is a fortress and temple ruin located in the north of Phondey village (inside the Phondey village) of Paro District.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village).

src: 據說在 1649 年，活佛夏仲阿旺朗傑為了紀念他對抗西藏蒙古軍隊的勝利，而興建了該碉堡。
mt: It is said that in 1649, the living Buddha, Xia Zhong Awang Langjie, built this fort to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan Mongolian army.
ref: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces.

src: 1951 年，一場大火使得杜克耶古堡只遺下了一部份的文物，像夏巴尊王的畫像。
mt: In 1951, a major fire left behind only a part of the artifacts, such as the portrait of King Shabazun.
ref: In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.

src: 大火過後，堡壘倖存且受到保護，仍是不丹最令人驚嘆的景點之一。
mt: After the great fire, the fortress survived and was protected, still one of Bhutan's most stunning attractions.
ref: After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: 西元 18 世紀中，柬埔寨被夾在兩個強大鄰國間，即泰國和越南。
mt: In the mid-18th century, Cambodia was sandwiched between two powerful neighboring countries, Thailand and Vietnam.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam.

src: 泰國人在 18 世紀多次侵略柬埔寨，並在 1772 年摧毀金邊。
mt: The Thais repeatedly invaded Cambodia in the 18th century and destroyed Phnom Penh in 1772.
ref: The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen.

src: 在 18 世紀最後幾年，越南人也入侵了柬埔寨。
mt: In the last few years of the 18th century, Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: 委內瑞拉有 18% 的人失業，而大部分受雇的人從事地下經濟的工作。
mt: In Venezuela, 18% of people are unemployed and most of them work in the underground economy.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy.

src: 三分之二的委內瑞拉工作人口從事服務業，將近四分之一的人從事工業，五分之一的人從事農業。
mt: Two-thirds of Venezuela's working population are engaged in service industries, nearly a quarter are engaged in industry, and one-fifth are engaged in agriculture.
ref: Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture.

src: 委內瑞拉人的重要產業是石油，僅管只有百分之一的人口在石油業工作，該國卻是石油淨出口國。
mt: Venezuela's most important industry is oil, although only one percent of the population works in the oil industry, the country is a net exporter of oil.
ref: An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: 在國家獨立的初期，新加坡植物園的專業知識協助將此島嶼轉變成一個熱帶花園城市。
mt: During the initial period of national independence, the expertise of Singapore's botanical garden helped transform this island into a tropical garden city.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City.

src: 1981 年，一種蘭花雜交種「卓錦萬代蘭」被獲選為該國國花。
mt: In 1981, a hybrid of orchids, the Panddai orchid, was selected as the national flower of the country.
ref: In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: 每年十月左右，都有將近 150 萬隻草食動物為了雨水，會從北邊的山丘跨越馬拉河，遷移至南方的平原。
mt: Every year around October, nearly 1.5 million herbivores cross the Mara River from the northern hills to the southern plains for rain.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains.

src: 四月左右的雨季後，牠們再次跨過馬拉河，然後經由西部回到北方。
mt: After the rainy season around April, they again crossed the Mara River and then returned to the north through the west.
ref: And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April.

src: 塞倫蓋蒂區域包括坦尚尼亞的塞倫蓋蒂國家公園、恩戈羅恩戈羅保護區和馬斯瓦野生動物保護區，以及肯亞的馬賽馬拉保護區。
mt: The Serengeti region includes Tanzania's Serengeti National Park, the Ngoroengoro Protected Area and the Maswa Wildlife Reserve, as well as Kenya's Maasai Mara Protected Area.
ref: The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: 學習創造互動式多媒體需要常規及傳統技能，也需要在互動式課程中學會的工具（分鏡、聲音及影像編輯、故事編劇等）。
mt: Learning to create interactive multimedia requires regular and traditional skills, as well as the tools learned in interactive courses (partition, sound and image editing, storywriting, etc.).
ref: Learning to create interactive media requires conventional and traditional skills, as well as tools mastered in interactive classes (storyboarding, audio and video editing, story telling, etc.)

src: 互動式設計需要你重新評估對媒體製作的假設，以及學習以非線性的方式思考。
mt: Interactive design requires you to reassess your assumptions about media production and learn to think nonlinearly.
ref: Interactive design requires that you re-assess your assumptions about media production and learn to think in a non-linear ways.

src: 互動式設計需要專案的各個構成要素相互連結，但作為單獨的實體也具有意義。
mt: Interactive design requires each component of the project to be interconnected, but as a separate entity it also has meaning.
ref: Interactive design requires that components of a project connect to each other, but also make sense as a separate entity.

src: 變焦鏡頭的缺點是，達到一定焦距範圍所需的焦點複雜度和鏡片元件數量，遠大於定焦鏡頭。
mt: The drawback of a zoom lens is that the complexity of the focal length and number of lens components required to achieve a certain focal length range far exceed that of a fixed focal length lens.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses.

src: 隨著鏡片製造商的鏡片生產達到更高水準，這已不再成為問題。
mt: This is no longer a problem as the lens manufacturer reaches a higher level of production.
ref: This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production.

src: 這已能使變焦鏡頭拍出與定焦鏡頭不相上下的照片品質。
mt: This can make the zoom lens shoot photos of the same quality as the fixed focal length lens.
ref: This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length.

src: 變焦鏡頭的另一缺點是鏡頭的最大光圈（速度）通常較低。
mt: Another drawback of a zoom lens is that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually lower.
ref: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower.

src: 這就使得平價的變焦鏡頭在低光源、無閃光燈的環境中難以使用。
mt: This makes it difficult for affordable zoom lenses to be used in low-light, no flash light environments.
ref: This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: 將一部電影轉換成 DVD 格式時，最常見的一種問題是畫面溢出。
mt: When converting a movie into DVD format, the most common problem is that the screen overflows.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan.

src: 多數電視節目的製作目的是取悅一般大眾。
mt: Most TV programs are made to please the general public.
ref: Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public.

src: 因此，你在電視上看到的所有畫面，邊界的上邊、下邊，和側邊都被切掉了。
mt: Therefore, all the images you see on TV, the top, bottom and sides of the border, are cut off.
ref: For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides.

src: 這麼做是為了確保圖像能蓋滿整個螢幕，這個動作稱為「過掃描」。
mt: This is done to ensure that the image can cover the entire screen, this action is called "overscanning".
ref: This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan.

src: 問題是，製作 DVD 時，邊緣很可能也會被切掉，如果影片中的字幕太靠近底部，就沒辦法完整顯示。
mt: The problem is that when making a DVD, the edges may also be cut off, and if the subtitles in the video are too close to the bottom, it cannot be displayed completely.
ref: Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: 長期以來，傳統的中世紀城堡激發了人們的想像力，使人想起馬上長槍比武、宴會和亞瑟王時代騎士精神的影像。
mt: For a long time, traditional medieval castles have stimulated people's imagination, reminding people of the image of the knightly spirit of King Arthur's era with long spears, banquets and the spirit of King Arthur.
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry.

src: 就算只是站在千年遺址之處，都能輕易回想起久遠之前戰爭的聲音和氣味，幾乎能聽到鵝卵石地上達達的蹄聲，感受到來自地牢坑裡的恐懼氣息。
mt: Even if you are standing in the site of a thousand-year-old archaeological site, you can easily recall the sounds and smells of war from a long time ago. You can almost hear the hooves of the cobblestone floor, and feel the fear atmosphere from the dungeon pits.
ref: Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits.

src: 但我們的想像是否基於現實？最初建造城堡的原因是什麼？它們是如何設計和建造的？
mt: But are our imaginations based on reality? What were the reasons for the initial construction of the castle? How were they designed and built?
ref: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: 柯比莫斯洛 (Kirby Muxloe) 城堡在當時極為典型，比較像是加強防守的住家，而非真正的城堡。
mt: The Kirby Muxloe Castle was very typical at the time, more like a fortified residence than a real castle.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle.

src: 它的大玻璃窗和薄牆無法長時間阻擋猛攻。
mt: Its large glass windows and thin walls cannot block attacks for a long time.
ref: Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long.

src: 1480 年代，當黑斯廷斯爵士開始建造這座城堡時，國家當時相對來說和平，只需要抵禦一些四處遊走的小群掠奪者。
mt: In the 1480s, when Sir Hastings began to build the castle, the country was relatively peaceful at the time, only needing to resist a small group of looters who had been roaming around.
ref: In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: 歐洲國家嘗試維持其國家主權的一種制度稱為權力平衡。
mt: A system in which European countries attempt to maintain their national sovereignty is called the balance of power.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states.

src: 這其中的概念是，所有歐洲國家必須努力預防單一國家壯大，因此各國政府常常改換同盟來維持平衡。
mt: This concept is that all European countries must make an effort to prevent a single country from expanding, so governments of each country often switch alliances to maintain balance.
ref: The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance.

src: 西班牙王位繼承戰爭成為以權力平衡為核心議題的第一場戰爭。
mt: The War of the Spanish Succession became the first war with power balance as its core issue.
ref: The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power.

src: 這是一項重大改變，代表歐洲列強不能再以宗教戰爭作為藉口，因此，三十年戰爭成為最後一場宗教戰爭。
mt: This was a major change, representing that European powers could no longer use religious warfare as an excuse, so the Thirty Years' War became the last religious war.
ref: This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: 位於艾費蘇斯的阿緹密絲神殿於西元前 356 年 7 月 21 日，因黑若史達特斯蓄意縱火而燒毀。
mt: The temple of Artemis, located in Ephesus, was burned down on July 21, 356 BC, by the deliberate arson of Black Whiskers.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus.

src: 從故事可知，他的動機來自不計代價獲取聲望。憤怒的以弗所人宣告黑若斯達特斯之名永遠都不會載入史冊。
mt: From the story, it is known that his motives came from achieving fame at all costs. The angry Ephesus declared that the name of Heraeus Dattus would never be recorded in the history books.
ref: According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded.

src: 希臘歷史學家史特拉波後來提到了這個名字，所以我們現在才會知道有這座神殿。神殿毀於亞歷山大大帝出生當晚。
mt: The name was later mentioned by the Greek historian Strabo, so we now know of this temple. The temple was destroyed on the night of the birth of Alexander the Great.
ref: The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born.

src: 亞歷山大作為國王主動提議出資重建神廟，但他的提議遭到否決。亞歷山大死後，神廟才於公元前 323 年被重建起來。
mt: Alexander, as king, volunteered to finance the rebuilding of the temple, but his proposal was rejected. It was only after Alexander's death that the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: 在正確敲擊所有音符的同時，手部要盡量放鬆，手指也不要有太多不必要的移動。
mt: While hitting all notes correctly, try to relax your hands as much as possible, and don’t move your fingers too much unnecessaryly.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers.

src: 如此您就可以盡可能地降低疲勞。請記住，不需要像彈鋼琴一樣用力敲擊琴鍵來增加音量。
mt: This way you can reduce fatigue as much as possible. Remember, you don’t have to force the keys to increase the volume by playing the piano.
ref: This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano.

src: 彈手風琴時，若要增大音量，可更用力或更快速擠壓風箱。
mt: When playing the accordion, if you want to increase the volume, you can press the air box more force or faster.
ref: On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: 神祕主義是追求與終極現實、神性、屬靈的真理、或神之間的交流、認同、或意識覺醒。
mt: Mysticism is the pursuit of communication, identification, or consciousness between the ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God.

src: 信仰者尋求對神性實相 / 神或眾神的直接體驗、直觀或洞悉。
mt: Believers seek direct experience, intuitiveness or insight into the nature of God/God or the gods.
ref: The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties.

src: 跟隨者尋求旨在滋養這些體驗的特定生活或修行方式。
mt: Followers seek specific ways of living or practicing to nourish these experiences.
ref: Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences.

src: 神祕主義與其它宗教信仰與崇拜能有所分別，是因為它看重個人對於一種獨特意識狀態的直接經驗，尤其是那種平和、洞察、喜悅、甚至是狂喜的特質。
mt: Mysticism differs from other religious beliefs and worship in that it emphasizes a person's direct experience of a unique state of consciousness, especially the peaceful, insightful, joyful, or even ecstasy characteristic.
ref: Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: 錫克教是源自印度次大陸的宗教。其起源為 15 世紀旁遮普地區自印度教傳統中分裂出來的派別。
mt: Sikhism is a religion that originated from the Indian subcontinent. It originated in the 15th century Punjabi region from the Indian Hindu tradition split off.
ref: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition.

src: 雖然他們承認來自印度教的根源與傳統，但錫克教徒認為自身的信仰不同於印度教。
mt: Although they acknowledge their roots and traditions from Hinduism, Sikhs believe their own beliefs are different from those of Hinduism.
ref: Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions.

src: 錫克教徒將他們的信仰稱為古馬特 (Gurmat)，在旁遮普語中意指「上師之道」。上師是所有印度信仰的基礎，但在錫克教裡，上師構成了整個信仰的重要核心。
mt: Sikhs call their faith the Gurmat, which means “the way of the Master” in Punjabi. The Master is the foundation of all Indian faiths, but in Sikhism, the Master forms an important core of the whole faith.
ref: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the guru". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs.

src: 此宗教是由古魯那奈克（1469–1539）於 15 世紀所創立。在他之後又依序出現了九位大師。
mt: This religion was founded in the 15th century by Gurunaneke (1469–1539). After that, nine more masters appeared.
ref: The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus.

src: 不過，1956 年 6 月時，波蘭的工人為食物短缺和減薪進行抗議，卻轉變成對共產主義的普遍抗議，這些動亂讓赫魯雪夫的承諾受到考驗。
mt: However, in June 1956, workers in Poland protested against food shortages and wage cuts, but this turned into a general protest against communism, putting Khrushchev's promise to the test.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism.

src: 雖然赫魯雪夫最後派出坦克來恢復秩序，但他還是在某些經濟要求上做出讓步，並同意任命受到愛戴的瓦迪斯瓦夫·哥穆爾卡擔任新總理。
mt: Although Khrushchev finally sent tanks to restore order, he still made concessions in some economic demands and agreed to appoint the beloved Wadisław Gomurka as the new prime minister.
ref: Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: 印度河流域文明是印度次大陸西北部的青銅時代文明，範圍涵蓋現今巴基斯坦的大部分、印度西北及阿富汗東北的部分地區。
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization is a Bronze Age civilization in the northwestern part of the Indian subcontinent, covering most of present-day Pakistan, parts of northwestern India and northeastern Afghanistan.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.

src: 此文明於印度河流域興盛發展，這也是它名稱的由來。
mt: This civilization flourished and developed in the Indus River Valley, which is also the origin of its name.
ref: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name.

src: 雖然有的學者推測由於該文明也存在於現已乾涸的薩拉斯瓦蒂河流域，因此理應稱其為印度河-薩拉斯瓦蒂文明，而有的學者則以 1920 年代挖掘的第一處遺址哈拉帕為名，稱其為哈拉帕文明。
mt: Although some scholars speculated that the civilization also existed in the now dry Saraswati River basin, it should be called the Indus-Saraswati civilization, while others called it the Harappa civilization after the first archaeological site excavated in the 1920s.
ref: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: 羅馬帝國軍國主義的本質，有助於醫學進步的發展。
mt: The essence of Roman Empire's militarism helped the development of medical progress.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances.

src: 奧古斯都皇帝開始招募醫生，這些醫生甚至成立了第一支用於戰後時期的羅馬醫療隊。
mt: Augustus began to recruit doctors, these doctors even established the first Roman medical team for post-war periods.
ref: Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles.

src: 醫生已經知道許多種鎮定劑的存在了，包括從罌粟花籽中提煉出的嗎啡和莨菪籽中的莨菪鹼。
mt: Doctors already knew the existence of many sedatives, including morphine extracted from poppy seeds and selenium seeds.
ref: Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds.

src: 他們精通截肢術，將患者從壞疽與因止血帶和動脈夾鉗阻止血液流動所造成的傷害中拯救出來。
mt: They are proficient in amputation, rescuing patients from the damage caused by anthrax and blood clots and arterial clamps that prevent blood flow.
ref: They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow.

src: 數世紀以來，羅馬帝國在醫學領域的研究成果豐碩，奠定現今許多醫學知識的基礎。
mt: For centuries, the Roman Empire's research achievements in the field of medicine have been rich, laying the foundation for many modern medical knowledge.
ref: Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: 淨土 (Pureland) 摺紙是規定一次只能一摺的摺紙類型，不可以使用反摺等更複雜的摺法，而且每個摺都有明確的位置。
mt: Pureland origami is a type of paper that can only be folded at a time, and can not be folded back into more complex ways, with each fold having a clear position.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations.

src: 約翰‧史密斯在七零年代發展出此方法，為了幫助摺紙新手或較不靈活的摺紙練習者。
mt: John Smith developed this method in the 1970s to help paper folding novices or less flexible paper folding practitioners.
ref: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: 兒童很早就能意識到種族差異及種族刻板印象，而這些種族刻板印象會影響其行為。
mt: Children can be aware of racial differences and racial stereotypes very early on, which will affect their behavior.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior.

src: 比方說，人們對少數族裔抱有在校表現不良的刻板印象，自詡為此族裔的兒童得知此刻板印象與其種族的關聯後，在校表現也往往不良。
mt: For example, people have a stereotype that minority groups have poor performance at school, and since they claim to be children of this ethnic group know this stereotype is related to their race, they often perform poorly in school.
ref: For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: MySpace 是美國排名第三受使用者歡迎的網站，目前有 5 千 4 百萬個帳戶。
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States, with 54 million active accounts.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.

src: 這些網站獲得了很多關注，尤其是在教育領域方面。
mt: These websites have received a lot of attention, especially in the field of education.
ref: These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting.

src: 這些網站的優點包含能輕鬆建立班級頁面，涵蓋了部落格、影片、照片與其他功能。
mt: The advantages of these websites include the ease of creating class pages, covering blogs, videos, photos and other functions.
ref: There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.

src: 只要提供一個網址就可以輕易開啟這個網頁，這對在使用鍵盤或拼字上有困難的學生來說，更容易記憶與輸入。
mt: As long as you provide a website address, this webpage can be easily opened, which is easier for students who have difficulty using keyboard or spelling to remember and input.
ref: This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling.

src: 您可自訂頁面，使之易於閱讀：亦可根據喜好，使用大量或少量顏色。
mt: You can customize the page to make it easy to read: you can also use a lot or a small amount of color to your liking.
ref: It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: 注意力缺失症「是一種神經性綜合症狀，其典型的三種症狀包含衝動、分心、過動或精力過剩。」
mt: Attention Deficit Disorder is a neurotic syndrome, characterized by three typical symptoms: impulse, distraction, hyperactivity or over-energy.
ref: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy".

src: 它並非學習障礙，而是學習疾患；「有 3-5 % 的兒童受其影響，大概等同於 2 百萬的美國兒童」。
mt: It's not a learning disability, it's a learning disorder. "Three to five percent of children are affected by it, roughly equivalent to two million American children."
ref: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children".

src: 患有注意力缺失症的兒童，很難專注於學校作業之類的事物，但他們能專心做自己有興趣的事情，比方玩遊戲或觀賞他們喜歡的卡通，或書寫文句但不加標點符號。
mt: Children with attention-deficit disorder have difficulty concentrating on things like schoolwork, but they can focus on doing things that interest them, such as playing games or watching their favorite cartoons, or writing sentences without punctuation.
ref: Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation.

src: 這些孩子容易惹上很多麻煩，因為他們不能用尋常的方法刺激大腦，要「做出危險的行為、牽扯進打架並挑戰權威」才能刺激大腦。
mt: These children are prone to getting into a lot of trouble because they cannot stimulate the brain with ordinary methods, and only "make dangerous behaviors, get involved in fighting and challenge authority" can stimulate the brain.
ref: These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they "engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods.
