src: 注意力缺乏症影響與其他同儕的關係，因為其他孩子不能理解他們為何會有這種作為，或是他們為何會這樣拼音，或是他們的成熟度不同。
mt: Attention Deficit Disorder affects relationships with other peers, because other children cannot understand why they do this, or why they spell it like that, or why their maturity is different.
ref: ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different.

src: 當獲取知識和學習的能力如上所述那樣改變時，獲取知識的基本速率就會跟著改變。
mt: When the ability to acquire knowledge and learn changes as described above, the basic rate of acquiring knowledge will change accordingly.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed.

src: 獲得資訊的方式不同。壓力不再存在於個別的回憶中，而變得比較關注在憶起文字的能力。
mt: The way information is obtained is different. Stress no longer exists in individual memories and becomes more focused on the ability to recall words.
ref: The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus.

src: 本質上，文藝復興為知識的學習及傳播方式帶來重大改變。
mt: In essence, the Renaissance brought significant changes to the way knowledge was learned and disseminated.
ref: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: 與其他靈長類動物不同，人類不再將雙手用於在樹木間移動、負重或擺盪。
mt: Unlike other primates, humans no longer use their hands to move, weigh or swing between trees.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees.

src: 黑猩猩手和腳的尺寸與長度相當，反映了牠們的手在握拳行走時承受重量的作用。
mt: The size and length of the hand and foot of chimpanzees are equivalent, reflecting their weight-bearing effect when walking with fists.
ref: The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking.

src: 人類的手比腳短，且手的指骨較直。
mt: Human hands are shorter than legs, and the fingers of hands are straighter.
ref: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.

src: 兩百萬到三百萬年前的手骨化石，顯示從運動到操作，手部功能的轉變。
mt: Two to three million years ago, the fossilized bones of the hand bones show a transformation in the function of the hand, from movement to operation.
ref: Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: 有些人認為時常體驗多次人為誘發的清醒夢會變得非常疲倦。
mt: Some people think that frequently experiencing multiple artificially induced lucid dreaming will become very tired.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting.

src: 這種現象的主要原因是，清醒夢增加了快速動眼期狀態的間隔時間。
mt: The main reason for this phenomenon is that lucid dreaming increases the interval time between rapid eye movement states.
ref: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states.

src: 由於快速動眼期是人實際入眠且身體修復的階段，如果每晚發生次數降至過低，就會產生問題。
mt: Due to the rapid eye movement period is a stage where people actually fall asleep and their bodies are repaired, if the frequency of each night falls too low, it will cause problems.
ref: With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem.

src: 這就跟您每二十或三十分鐘醒來看電視一樣累。
mt: It's as tired as you'd wake up every 20 or 30 minutes to watch TV.
ref: This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.

src: 影響程度取決於你的腦袋每晚嘗試做清醒夢的頻率。
mt: The degree of impact depends on how often your brain tries to dream lucidly each night.
ref: The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: 幾乎從一開始，義大利人在北非的進展就很不順利。在義大利於 1940 年 6 月 10 日宣戰後一週內，英國第 11 輕騎兵團就佔領了利比亞的卡普佐堡。
mt: From the very beginning, the Italians were very unsatisfactory in North Africa. Just a week after Italy declared war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Light Cavalry Regiment occupied Capzog in Libya.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.

src: 在巴第亞東部的一次伏擊中，英軍俘虜了義大利第十軍團的工兵總隊長拉斯圖奇將軍。
mt: In a surprise attack on the eastern part of Barthia, the British captured General Lastozzi, commander of the Italian Tenth Army's Corps of Engineers.
ref: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.

src: 6 月 28 日，利比亞總督—明顯是墨索里尼 (Mussolini) 的繼承者伊塔洛·巴爾博 (Italo Balbo) 元帥，在登陸圖卜魯格時被友軍炮火炸死。
mt: On 28 June, Marshal Italo Balbo, clearly the successor of Mussolini, was killed by artillery fire on the landing in Tubrug.
ref: On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: 現代運動擊劍具有許多級別。從大學學習的學生，到職業以及奧運競賽都有。
mt: Modern sport fencing has many levels. From college students to professional and Olympic competitions.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition.

src: 這種運動主要以決鬥模式進行，由一名擊劍選手對決另一名選手。
mt: This type of sport is mainly conducted in a duel mode, with one fencing player competing against another player.
ref: The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: 高爾夫球這種運動，是球員用球桿把球打進洞裡。
mt: Golf is a sport in which a player uses a club to throw the ball into a hole.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes.

src: 一場標準比賽是 18 洞，球員一般從球場的第一洞開始，然後在第 18 洞結束。
mt: A standard game is 18 holes, players generally start from the first hole on the field and end at the 18th hole.
ref: Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth.

src: 打完全場後，由以最低桿數，也就是最少揮桿次數進洞的球員贏得比賽。
mt: After the game is complete, the player who has hit the hole with the lowest number of strokes wins the game.
ref: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins.

src: 球賽在草地上進行，球洞周圍的草割得較短，稱為果嶺。
mt: The game is played on grass, with the grass around the ball hole being cut short, called a fruit ridge.
ref: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: 也許最常見的旅遊型態正是多數人對旅行的聯想：休閒旅遊。
mt: Perhaps the most common form of travel is what most people think of as leisure travel.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.

src: 就是去一些跟日常生活環境截然不同的地方，放鬆玩樂。
mt: Just go to some places that are completely different from daily life, relax and have fun.
ref: This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun.

src: 海灘、主題公園和露營區通常是休閒遊客經常造訪的常見地方。
mt: Beaches, theme parks and campsites are often popular places for leisure tourists to visit.
ref: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists.

src: 如果造訪特定地點的目的是為了瞭解其歷史及文化，則此類型的旅遊稱為文化之旅。
mt: If the purpose of visiting a specific location is to understand its history and culture, this type of travel is called cultural tour.
ref: If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.

src: 遊客可以造訪某國家的不同地標，或選擇聚焦於一個地區。
mt: Visitors can visit different landmarks of a certain country, or choose to focus on one area.
ref: Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: 殖民地開拓者看到這樣的佈署，也號招了增援部隊。
mt: The settlers saw this deployment and called for reinforcements.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements.

src: 支援前鋒的部隊包括新罕布夏州的第一和第三軍團兩百人，由約翰‧斯塔克上校和詹姆斯‧里德上校領導（兩人後來都成為將軍）。
mt: The forces supporting the forwards included 200 men from the First and Third Armies of New Hampshire, led by Colonel John Stark and Colonel James Reed (both later becoming generals).
ref: Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals).

src: 史塔克的人馬佔領了殖民軍據點北端柵欄沿線的位置。
mt: Stark's men and horses occupied the position along the northernmost fence of the colonial army stronghold.
ref: Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position.

src: 沿著半島西北部流動的神秘河，在退潮時打開了一個缺口，他們利用這個時機迅速建造小石牆，將圍牆延伸到北方河流末端的小沙灘上。
mt: A mysterious river flowing along the northwest coast of the peninsula opened a gap at low tide, and they used this opportunity to quickly build small stone walls, extending the wall to the small sandy beach at the end of the northern river.
ref: When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach.

src: 格里德利 (Gridley) 或史塔克 (Stark) 在柵欄前約 100 英尺（30 公尺）處設置一根木樁，並下令在正規軍通過木樁之前，任何人不得開槍。
mt: Gridley or Stark set up a wooden stake about 100 feet (30 meters) in front of the fence, and ordered no one to shoot before the regular army passed through the stakes.
ref: Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: 美國的計畫仰仗從三個方向同時發動攻擊。
mt: The U.S. plan relies on launching an attack from three directions simultaneously.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions.

src: 約翰·卡德瓦爾德 (John Cadwalder) 將軍將對在博登敦 (Bordentown) 的英國駐軍發動牽制攻擊，以封鎖任何支援部隊。
mt: General John Cadwalder will launch a containment attack on British troops stationed in Bordentown to blockade any supporting forces.
ref: General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements.

src: 詹姆斯·尤因 (James Ewing) 將軍將用特倫頓渡輪 (Trenton Ferry) 領七百名民兵渡河，佔領阿遜平克溪 (Assunpink Creek) 上的橋，並防止任何敵軍逃脫。
mt: General James Ewing will lead 700 militiamen across the river on Trenton Ferry, occupying the bridge over Assunpink Creek and preventing any enemy from escaping.
ref: General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping.

src: 由 2,400 人組成的主要突擊部隊會在特倫頓以北九英里處過河，然後分成兩組，一組由格林帶領，另一組由蘇利文帶領，在破曉前發動進攻。
mt: The main assault force of 2,400 men will cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, then divide into two groups, one led by Green and the other led by Sullivan, launching an attack before dawn.
ref: The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: 由於跑步距離從四分之一英里改為半英里，速度的重要性變得越來越低，耐力變成為絕對必要的條件。
mt: Due to the distance of running being changed from a quarter mile to half a mile, the importance of speed became increasingly low, and endurance became an absolutely necessary condition.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity.

src: 當然，一流的跑者，可以在兩分鐘內跑完八百公尺的人，速度一定夠快，但他不論如何一定要培養耐力。
mt: Of course, a top runner must be able to run 800 meters in two minutes at a fast pace, but no matter how hard he is, he must develop stamina.
ref: Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards.

src: 冬天適度的越野長跑，加上強化上身的體操訓練，是為跑季準備的最佳方式。
mt: A moderate amount of cross-country long-distance running in winter, combined with strengthened upper body gymnastics training, is the best way to prepare for the season.
ref: Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: 僅攝取適當的營養並無法造就頂尖的成績，但可大幅影響年輕運動員的整體健康。
mt: Consuming only proper nutrition cannot achieve top-notch results, but it can significantly affect the overall health of young athletes.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness.

src: 維持健康的能量平衡、遵守真正有效的飲水習慣，並全面了解補充營養品，都能幫助運動員改進運動成績、提升運動樂趣。
mt: Maintaining a healthy energy balance, adhering to truly effective drinking habits, and a comprehensive understanding of nutritional supplements can help athletes improve their athletic performance and enhance their sports fun.
ref: Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: 中長跑是一種相對花費較少的運動項目，用以參加此項競技所需的裝備極少，但對於這些裝備則存在著許多錯誤觀念。
mt: Long-distance running is a relatively low-cost sport, with very few equipment needed to participate in this competition, but there are many misconceptions about these equipment.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate.

src: 需要時可購買此類產品，但多數對實質表現影響不大或甚至沒有影響。
mt: These types of products can be purchased when needed, but most have little or no impact on actual performance.
ref: Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance.

src: 即使產品無法提供真正的好處，運動員仍偏好使用某產品。
mt: Even if a product cannot provide true benefits, athletes still prefer to use a certain product.
ref: Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: 所有物質的基本組成部分之一為原子。
mt: One of the basic components of all materials is atoms.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter.

src: 原子是一組非常複雜的結構。根據簡化的波爾模型，其包含在中央的核心，以及環繞核心的電子，與環繞太陽的行星有些類似。見圖表 1.1。
mt: Atoms are a very complex set of structures. According to the simplified Bohr model, the central core, and the electrons that surround it, are somewhat similar to planets around the Sun. See Chart 1.1.
ref: Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1.

src: 原子核由中子和質子兩種粒子組成。
mt: The nucleus is composed of two types of particles, neutron and proton.
ref: The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons.

src: 質子帶有正電荷，中子不帶電荷，電子則具有負電荷。
mt: Protons have a positive charge, neutrons do not carry a charge, and electrons have a negative charge.
ref: Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: 檢查傷者之前，你必須先觀察周邊環境，確保自己的安全。
mt: Before checking on the injured, you must first observe the surrounding environment to ensure your own safety.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety.

src: 靠近傷者時須注意傷者位置和任何出現的警訊。
mt: When approaching the injured person, pay attention to the location of the injured person and any warning signs that appear.
ref: You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags.

src: 如果你在試圖幫助時受傷，可能只會讓事態變得更糟。
mt: If you get hurt while trying to help, it can only make things worse.
ref: If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: 研究發現，抑鬱、恐懼感和災難化可以調解下背部疼痛患者疼痛與失能之間的關係。
mt: Research has found that depression, fear and disaster can mediate the relationship between pain and disability in patients with lower back pain.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers.

src: 只有災難性的，而非抑鬱和恐懼的作用，才是需要每週定期結構性身體活動訓練的條件。
mt: Only disastrous, rather than the effects of depression and fear, are conditions that require regular weekly structured physical activity training.
ref: Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions.

src: 那些進行規律活動的人在對於疼痛的負面感知即慢性疼痛及一般物理性動作所造成的不適感之間的區別，需要更多的協助。
mt: Those who engage in regular activities require more assistance in the distinction between a negative perception of pain, namely chronic pain and general physical movements causing discomfort.
ref: Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: 視力，或視物的能力，來自視覺系統的感覺器官或眼睛。
mt: The ability of vision, or visual objects, comes from the sensory organs or eyes of the visual system.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes.

src: 眼睛包含許多不同構造，各構造的複雜度依其對有機體需求不同而有差別。
mt: The eyes contain many different structures, the complexity of each structure varies depending on its requirements for an organism.
ref: There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism.

src: 不同的結構有不同的功能、對不同的波長敏感、具有不同的敏銳度，還需要不同的處理過程來理解輸入，以及不同的數量達到最佳效率。
mt: Different structures have different functions, are sensitive to different wavelengths, have different sensitivity, and need different processing processes to understand input, as well as different quantities to achieve the best efficiency.
ref: The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: 族群指的是在特定地理區域中活動的單一特定物種生物個體組成的群體。
mt: A group refers to a group of individuals from a single specific species living in a specific geographical region.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area.

src: 當群體內的所有個體在特定表徵方面都一致之時，便稱為單型性。
mt: When all individuals within a group are consistent in specific characteristics, it is called monotypic.
ref: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic.

src: 如果個體某項特徵呈現多種差異，即稱為多態性。
mt: If an individual's characteristic presents multiple differences, it is called polymorphism.
ref: When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: 螞蟻大軍也在不同階段行軍和築巢。
mt: Ant armies also march and build nests at different stages.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well.

src: 在游獵階段，行軍蟻會在夜晚行動，白天停下來紮營。
mt: During the hunting stage, marching ants will act at night and stop to set up camp during the day.
ref: In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day.

src: 當食物量減少時，殖民地居民進入了一種遊牧階段。在此階段，殖民地居民建築起暫時性的住所，並且每天變換。
mt: As the amount of food decreased, the colonists entered a nomadic phase. At this stage, the colonists built temporary residences and changed daily.
ref: The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday.

src: 這種橫衝直撞的遷徙或行進，每次持續約 17 天。
mt: This kind of direct-impact migration or movement, each lasting about 17 days.
ref: Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: 什麼是細胞？細胞一詞來自拉丁語「cella」，意指「小房間」，而最初是由一位使用顯微鏡觀察軟木塞結構的人率先使用這個詞彙。
mt: What is a cell? The term "cell" comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and was first used by someone who used a microscope to observe the structure of corks.
ref: What is a cell? The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and it was first coined by a microscopist observing the structure of cork.

src: 細胞是所有生物的基本單位，所有的生命體都是由一個或多個細胞組成的。
mt: Cells are the basic units of all living things, and all life forms are composed of one or more cells.
ref: The cell is the basic unit of all living things, and all organisms are composed of one or more cells.

src: 細胞對於生命的研究是如此基本而重要，事實上，它們常被稱作「生命的積木」。
mt: Cell research on life is so basic and important, in fact, they are often called "building blocks of life".
ref: Cells are so basic and critical to the study of life, in fact, that they are often referred to as "the building blocks of life".

src: 神經系統藉由發送神經衝動到全身，保持血液流動且不受干擾，進而維持體內恆定。
mt: The nervous system maintains a constant state of the body by sending nerve impulses throughout the body, keeping blood flowing without interference.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed.

src: 這些神經脈衝以極快的速度傳送到身體各處，協助身體避開潛在威脅。
mt: These nerve pulses are transmitted to various parts of the body at extremely fast speeds, helping the body avoid potential threats.
ref: These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: 龍捲風與其他猛烈的風暴相比，侵襲的範圍較小，但它們能夠摧毀所有它們所經之處的東西。
mt: Compared to other violent storms, tornadoes have a smaller invasion range, but they can destroy everything they pass through.
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path.

src: 龍捲風能將樹連根拔起，將建築物上的木板扯掉，並將車輛拋向空中。龍捲風之中最猛烈的 2% 能持續超過 3 小時。
mt: A tornado pulls trees up, rips wooden boards off buildings and throws vehicles into the air. The strongest of the tornadoes lasts for more than 3 hours.
ref: Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours.

src: 這些怪獸風暴的風速高達每小時 480 公里（每秒 133 公尺；每小時 300 英里）。
mt: These monster storms have winds of up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: 人類幾千年來一直在製造透鏡，並使用它的放大功能。
mt: Humans have been manufacturing lenses for thousands of years and using its magnifying function.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years.

src: 但第一架真正的望遠鏡是 16 世紀末才在歐洲被製造出來的。
mt: But the first real telescope was made in Europe in the late 16th century.
ref: However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century.

src: 這些望遠鏡使用兩個鏡片，讓遠方的物體顯得更近且更大。
mt: These telescopes use two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: 我們將永遠無法擺脫貪婪與自私。合作的本質就是當大多數人受益時，自私的行為在短期總能得到更多利益。
mt: We will never be able to escape greed and selfishness. The essence of cooperation is that when most people benefit, selfish behavior always gets more benefits in the short term.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly

src: 希望多數人終將明白他們長期的最佳選擇是與他人合作。
mt: Hopefully most people will eventually understand that their best long-term best option is to cooperate with others.
ref: Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: 許多人夢想著有一天，人類能到達另一個星球，探索其他嶄新的世界；有些人對太陽系外的事物感到好奇；有些則相信外星人或其他形式的生命可能存在於另一顆星球之上。
mt: Many people dream that one day, humans can reach another planet and explore other new worlds; some are curious about things outside the solar system; others believe that life from aliens or other forms may exist on another planet.
ref: Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant.

src: 但是，如果這確實發生過，那麼可能很長一段時間內都不會再發生。天體分散得如此之廣，以至於「比鄰」天體就相隔了數兆英里。
mt: However, if this did happen, it would not happen again for a very long time. The celestial body is so scattered that the neighboring celestial body is separated by several trillions of miles.
ref: But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are "neighbors".

src: 或許未來的某一天，你的曾孫會在站在外星人的世界中，好奇自己的祖先是誰？
mt: Perhaps one day your great-grandsons will be standing in an alien world and wondering who their ancestors were.
ref: Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?

src: 動物由眾多細胞構成。牠們吃東西並在體內消化。多數動物都能移動。
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat and digest in the body. Most animals can move.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move.

src: 只有動物有大腦（然而甚至不是所有動物都有；例如水母就沒有大腦）。
mt: Only animals have brains (although not all animals have them; for example, jellyfish do not have brains).
ref: Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains).

src: 地球各處均能發現動物。牠們在地上挖洞、在海裡游泳、在空中飛翔。
mt: Animals can be found all over the Earth. They dig holes on the ground, swim in the sea, and fly in the air.
ref: Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: 細胞是生命 (物) 有機體最小的構造單位和功能單位。
mt: Cells are the smallest structural units and functional units of living organisms.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism.

src: 細胞一詞來自拉丁文的 cella，意指小空間。
mt: The term "cell" comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning small space.
ref: Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room.

src: 如果你在顯微鏡下觀察生物，你會看到生物是由小方塊或小圓球組成。
mt: If you're looking at an organism under a microscope, you'll see that it's made up of small squares or little spheres.
ref: If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls.

src: 英國生物學家羅伯‧虎克透過顯微鏡觀察到軟木塞中的小方塊。
mt: British biologist Robert Hooke observed small blocks in a softwood sledge using a microscope.
ref: Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope.

src: 它們看起來像一個個房間。他是首位觀察到死亡細胞的人。
mt: They look like one room at a time. He was the first person to observe death cells.
ref: They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: 元素和化合物可以從一種狀態移動到另外一種狀態時，而本質不會產生變化。
mt: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another, but their essence does not change.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change.

src: 氮在氣態之下，仍然與液態氮具有相同的性質。儘管液態密度較高，但兩者分子組成是一樣的。
mt: ⁇  has the same properties as liquid nitrogen under gaseous conditions. Although liquid density is higher, the molecular composition of the two is the same.
ref: Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same.

src: 水是另一個例子。水是由兩個氫原子和一個氧原子組成的。
mt: Water is another example. Water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
ref: Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

src: 不論是氣體、液體或固體型態，都有相同的分子結構。
mt: Regardless of gas, liquid or solid state, there are identical molecular structures.
ref: It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid.

src: 雖然它的物理狀態可能會改變，但它的化學狀態依舊不變。
mt: Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains unchanged.
ref: Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: 時間就在我們周圍，影響著我們所做的一切，但又很難理解。
mt: Time is all around us, affecting everything we do, but it's hard to understand.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand.

src: 數千年來，宗教、哲學與科學學者都在研究時間。
mt: For thousands of years, scholars of religion, philosophy and science have been studying time.
ref: Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years.

src: 我們是以從未來到現在、再到過去的一連串事件來感知時間。
mt: We perceive time by a series of events from the future to the present and to the past.
ref: We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past.

src: 時間也是我們比對事件持續期間（長度）的方式。
mt: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of an event.
ref: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events.

src: 可透過觀察重複的週期性事件來標記自己的時間流逝。週期性事件指的是定期不斷重複發生的事。
mt: You can mark your own time-lapse by observing repeated periodic events. Periodic events refer to things that repeat regularly.
ref: You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: 現在都用電腦來修改照片和影片。
mt: Now they're all using computers to modify photos and videos.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos.

src: 我們可以用電腦做出精緻複雜的動畫，這種動畫越來越常出現在電視與電影上。
mt: We can use computers to make intricate animations, which are increasingly appearing on television and film.
ref: Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films.

src: 音樂錄製的方式，通常是以精密的電腦處理並進行混音。
mt: The way music is recorded is usually processed and mixed with precise computers.
ref: Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: 十九到二十世紀的很長一段時間，人們都相信紐西蘭的第一批居民是毛利人，他們會獵捕稱為恐鳥的巨鳥。
mt: For a long time from the 19th to the 20th centuries, people believed that New Zealand's first inhabitants were Maori people, who would hunt giant birds called terror birds.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas.

src: 該理論隨後確立一個觀點，認為毛利人乘坐大艦隊，自玻里尼西亞開始遷徙，然後從莫里奧里人手中奪取紐西蘭，並建立一個農業社會。
mt: This theory later established a view that the Maori people took advantage of the large fleet, began to migrate from Polynesia, and then took New Zealand from the Moriori people, establishing an agricultural society.
ref: The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society.

src: 然而，新的證據指出，莫里奧里人是一個紐西蘭大陸的毛利人族群，他們從紐西蘭遷徙到查塔姆群島，發展出了自己獨特的和平文化。
mt: However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori are a Maori ethnic group from the New Zealand mainland who migrated to the Chatham Islands from New Zealand and developed their own unique peaceful culture.
ref: However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture.

src: 查塔姆群島上還有另一個部落，他們是從紐西蘭移民而來的毛利人。
mt: There is another tribe on the Chatham Islands, which are Maori immigrants from New Zealand.
ref: There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand.

src: 它們稱自己為莫里奧里人，之前發生了一些小衝突，而最終莫里奧里人被抹消了。
mt: They call themselves the Moriori, and previously there were some minor conflicts that ultimately led to the elimination of the Moriori.
ref: They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: 數十年來的長期參與者，可協助我們了解自己的長處和熱情，並坦誠評估自己的困境，甚至是失敗。
mt: Decades of long-term participants help us understand our strengths and passions, and honestly assess our predicaments and even failures.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures.

src: 聆聽個人分享自己、家庭和組織的故事時，我們會聽到寶貴的觀點，更深一層了解過去或對組織文化帶來正負面影響的人物。
mt: When we listen to people sharing their stories about themselves, their families and their organizations, we hear valuable insights into people who have a deeper understanding of the past or have a positive and negative impact on organizational culture.
ref: While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization.

src: 儘管了解一個人的歷史並不代表了解文化，但這至少可以讓人理解他們在組織的歷史中處在什麼樣的位置上。
mt: Although understanding a person's history does not mean understanding culture, it at least gives people an understanding of where they are in the history of an organization.
ref: While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization.

src: 評估成功和漸漸意識到失敗的同時，個人和全體參與人員將更深入發現組織的價值、使命和驅動力。
mt: While evaluating success and gradually realizing failure, individuals and all participants will delve deeper into the organization's values, mission, and drivers.
ref: While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization.

src: 在這種情況下，回想起過去的創業行為及成功經驗，可幫助人們樂於接受當地教會的新改變與新方向。
mt: In this situation, recalling past entrepreneurial behavior and successful experiences can help people be happy to accept the new changes and directions of local churches.
ref: In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church.

src: 這種成功故事可以減弱對於改變的恐懼，同時讓人更願意接受未來的改變。
mt: This kind of success story can reduce the fear of change, and make people more willing to accept future changes.
ref: Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: 聚斂性思考模式是解決問題的技巧，透過結合不同的想法或領域來找出解決方法。
mt: Convergence thinking mode is a skill to solve problems, by combining different ideas or fields to find solutions.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution.

src: 這種思考模式的焦點在於快速、合邏輯和精確，以及辨別事實、重新應用既有的技術、收集資訊。
mt: This type of thinking mode focuses on speed, logic and accuracy, identifying facts, reapplying existing technology, and collecting information.
ref: The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information.

src: 這種心態最重要的特點就是只有一個正確答案。只考慮兩種解答，即對或不對。
mt: The most important feature of this mindset is that there is only one correct answer. Just consider two kinds of answers, right or wrong.
ref: The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong.

src: 這種思維方式與特定的科學或標準程序有關。
mt: This way of thinking is related to specific science or standard procedures.
ref: This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures.

src: 這類思考模式的人擅邏輯，他們能記住模式、解決問題、進行科學測試。
mt: These types of thinking people are good at logic, they can remember patterns, solve problems, and conduct scientific tests.
ref: People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: 人類是目前為止最有能力揣摩他人心思的物種。
mt: Humans are by far the most capable species to grasp the thoughts of others.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others.

src: 這意味著我們能夠成功預測其他人類的感知、意圖、信仰、理解和渴望。
mt: This means that we can successfully predict other humans' perceptions, intentions, beliefs, understanding and desires.
ref: That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire.

src: 這些能力中，能夠了解他人的意圖至關重要。這個能力讓我們得以釐清身體動作可能帶有的含糊意義。
mt: Understanding the intentions of others is crucial to these abilities. This ability allows us to clarify the ambiguity of bodily movements.
ref: Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions.

src: 舉例來說，如果您看到某個人正在打破車窗，您可能會假定他正在偷陌生人的車。
mt: For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you might assume he's stealing a stranger's car.
ref: For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car.

src: 如果他是遺失了自己的車鑰匙，並試著強行進入他自己的車子裡，那他應該受到不一樣的審判。
mt: If he had lost his own car key and tried to force him into his own car, he should be tried differently.
ref: He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: 磁振造影 (MRI) 的基礎是一種稱為核磁共振 (NMR) 的物理現象，該現像是由菲利克斯‧布洛赫（史丹佛大學）和愛德華‧珀塞爾（哈佛大學）在 1930 年代發現的。
mt: The basis of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered by Felix Bloch (Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (Harvard University) in the 1930s.
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University).

src: 共振時，磁場和無線電波會使原子發出微小的無線電信號。
mt: During resonance, magnetic fields and radio waves will cause atoms to emit small radio signals.
ref: In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals.

src: 1970 年，研究科學家雷蒙德．達馬迪安醫生發現了使用磁振造影作為醫療診斷工具的原理。
mt: In 1970, Dr. Raymond Damadian, a research scientist, discovered the principle of using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool.
ref: In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis.

src: 四年後獲得一項專利，這是世界上第一個 MRI 領域的專利。
mt: Four years later, a patent was granted, which is the world's first patent in the field of MRI.
ref: Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI.

src: 1977 年，達馬迪安醫生完成建造第一台「全身性」磁振造影掃描儀，他將之稱為「不屈者」。
mt: In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of his first full-body MRI scanner, which he called the "non-flexible."
ref: In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: 非同步交流讓我們有時間反思，思考如何回應他人。
mt: Asynchronous communication gives us time to reflect and think about how to respond to others.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others.

src: 這讓學生得以按照自己的步調學習，並控制教學資訊的呈現速度。
mt: This allows students to learn at their own pace and control the presentation speed of teaching information.
ref: It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information.

src: 而且時間限制較少，讓工作時間可以更加靈活。（布雷默，1998）
mt: And with less time constraints, working hours can be more flexible. (Bremer, 1998)
ref: In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998)

src: 網際網路和全球資訊網的使用，讓學習者無時無刻都能取得資訊。
mt: The use of the Internet and the global information network enables learners to obtain information at all times.
ref: The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times.

src: 學生也可以隨時提交問題給老師，並在合理時間內快速得到回覆，不必等到下一次面對面的會談。
mt: Students can also submit questions to the teacher at any time and get a quick response within a reasonable time, without having to wait for the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: 後現代的學習方法讓人能擺脫定則。學習的良方不只一種。
mt: Post-modern learning methods allow people to get rid of the rules. There are more than one good way to learn.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn.

src: 事實上，沒有什麼好事是特別要學習。學習發生在學習者與所呈現的知識間的經歷之中。
mt: In fact, there is nothing particularly good to learn. Learning takes place between the learner and the knowledge presented.
ref: In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented.

src: 從我們目前對 DIY 和資訊呈現的經驗來看，以教學為主的電視節目說明了這一點。
mt: From our current experience with DIY and information presentation, educational TV shows illustrate this point.
ref: Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point.

src: 因此，許多人會發現自己在電視節目中看到的是我們永遠都不會參與或應用的程序或經驗，我們永遠都用不到那些知識。
mt: Therefore, many people will find that what they see on TV programs is a program or experience that we will never participate in or apply to, and we will never use that knowledge.
ref: So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge.

src: 我們永遠不會去改造汽車、在後院蓋一座噴水池、去祕魯考察古代遺跡，或是翻修鄰居的房子。
mt: We will never go to remodel a car, build a fountain in the back yard, go to Peru to investigate ancient ruins, or renovate a neighbor's house.
ref: We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: 感謝連接到歐洲的海底光纖電纜和衛星寬頻，格陵蘭島上的網際網路非常發達，93% 人口皆能上網。
mt: Thanks to the submarine fiber optic cable and satellite broadband connection to Europe, the internet on Greenland Island is very developed, with 93% of the population able to access the Internet.
ref: Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access.

src: 旅館或主人（如果住在民宿或私人住宅）應能提供 WiFi 或可上網電腦，且所有社區皆有網咖或部分提供 WiFi 的地點。
mt: The hotel or owner (if living in a homestay or private home) should provide WiFi or a computer with Internet access in all communities, or Wi-Fi in some areas.
ref: Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi.

src: 如上所述，雖然美國仍可接受「愛斯基摩人」一詞，但許多非美裔的北極地區人民，尤其是加拿大人，卻視之為貶義。
mt: As mentioned above, although the United States can still accept the term "Eskimo people", many African-American people in the Arctic region, especially Canadians, are considered ⁇ .
ref: As mentioned above, though the word "Eskimo" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada.

src: 儘管你可能聽過格陵蘭島原住民使用這個詞，但外國人應該避免使用。
mt: Although you may have heard the term used by the indigenous people of Greenland, foreigners should avoid using it.
ref: While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners.

src: 在加拿大的格陵蘭原住民自稱為因紐特人，在格陵蘭則自稱為「Kalaalleq」（複數為 Kalaallit），意指「格陵蘭人」。
mt: In Canada, the indigenous people of Greenland call themselves Inuit; in Greenland, they call themselves "Kalaalleq" (plural Kalaallit), meaning "Greenlanders".
ref: The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland.

src: 對外來客犯罪和抱持惡意，一般來說在格陵蘭簡直前所未聞，即使是鬧區也沒有「危險地帶」。
mt: Crime and malice towards foreign visitors are generally unheard of in Greenland, even in noisy areas there is no "danger zone".
ref: Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no "rough areas."

src: 毫無準備的人唯一真正會遭遇的危險，也許就只有寒冷的天氣了。
mt: The only real danger a person without any preparation may face is the cold weather.
ref: Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face.

src: 如果你在寒冷季節造訪格陵蘭（愈往北走，天氣愈冷），一定要攜帶足以保暖的衣物。
mt: If you are visiting Greenland during the cold season (the farther north you go, the colder the weather), be sure to bring enough clothing to keep you warm.
ref: If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing.

src: 夏季漫長的白晝可能會導致難以獲得充足的睡眠等相關健康問題。
mt: Long daylight hours in summer may cause health problems such as difficulty getting adequate sleep.
ref: The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues.

src: 在夏季期間，也要慎防北歐的蚊子。雖然它們不會傳播任何疾病，但會令人不堪其擾。
mt: Beware of mosquitoes in Northern Europe during the summer months. Although they do not transmit any disease, they can be quite disturbing.
ref: During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating.

src: 舊金山的經濟雖然與其身為世界級觀光景點息息相關，不過這裡的經濟活動其實非常多元。
mt: San Francisco's economy is closely related to its status as a world-class tourist destination, but the economic activity here is actually very diverse.
ref: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified.

src: 就業人口最多的領域為專業服務、公家機關、金融、貿易和觀光。
mt: The area with the most employed population is professional services, public institutions, finance, trade and tourism.
ref: The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism.

src: 音樂、電影、文學和流行文化中的頻繁描述使這座城市及其地標變得舉世聞名。
mt: Frequent descriptions of music, film, literature and popular culture have made this city and its landmarks world-renowned.
ref: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world.

src: 舊金山發展出了大規模的觀光基礎建設，包括無數家飯店、餐廳，以及一流的會議設施。
mt: San Francisco has developed a large-scale tourist infrastructure, including numerous hotels, restaurants and first-class conference facilities.
ref: San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities.

src: 舊金山也是國內品嘗韓國菜、泰國菜、印度菜和日本菜等其他亞洲料理的最佳去處之一。
mt: San Francisco is also one of the best places to enjoy Korean, Thai, Indian and Japanese cuisines domestically.
ref: San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.

src: 對很多美國家庭而言，前往迪士尼世界遊玩是心目中最重要的朝聖之旅。
mt: For many American families, going to Disney World is the most important pilgrimage in their minds.
ref: Traveling to Walt Disney World represents a major pilgrimage for many American families.

src: 最「典型」的行程包括飛往奧蘭多國際機場、搭巴士前往迪士尼飯店、在迪士尼園區玩上一週後再回家。
mt: The most "typical" itinerary includes flying to Orlando International Airport, taking a bus to the Disney Hotel, playing in the Disney Park for a week before returning home.
ref: The "typical" visit involves flying into Orlando International Airport, busing to an on-site Disney hotel, spending about a week without leaving Disney property, and returning home.

src: 雖然有數不盡的各種可能，但多數人提到「去迪士尼世界」指的仍是這個。
mt: Although there are countless possibilities, most people still refer to "going to Disney World" as this.
ref: There are infinite variations possible, but this remains what most people mean when they talk of "going to Disney World".

src: 許多在 eBay 或 Craigslist 等拍賣網站上賣出的票券，是已被使用過一部分的主題樂園多日聯票。
mt: Many tickets sold on auction sites such as eBay and Craigslist have been used for multiple days in some theme parks.
ref: Many tickets sold online through auction websites such as eBay or Craigslist are partially used multi-day park-hopper tickets.

src: 儘管這是很常見的情況，但迪士尼禁止這種行為，因為門票是不可轉讓的。
mt: Although this is a very common situation, Disney prohibits such behavior because tickets are non-transferable.
ref: While this is a very common activity, it is prohibited by Disney: the tickets are non-transferable.

src: 必須具備野地許可證，才能在大峽谷邊緣之下的位置露營。
mt: Must have a wildland permit to camp below the edge of the Grand Canyon.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit.

src: 為了保護峽谷，許可證的數量有限，每月 1 號可申請四個月後的起程月許可證。
mt: To protect the canyon, the number of permits is limited, and each month No. 1 can apply for a four-month starting month permit.
ref: Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month.

src: 因此，5 月任一日期的偏遠地許可會在 1 月 1 日開放申請。
mt: Therefore, remote permits will be open for application on January 1st on any date in May.
ref: Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan.

src: 比鄰幻影牧場的光耀天使營地等最熱門的營位區通常在開放預約申請的第一天就滿額了。
mt: Popular campsites such as the Illumination Angel Camp at the neighboring Phantom Farm are usually full on the first day of open booking applications.
ref: Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations.

src: 現場登記的名額有限，採先到先得制。
mt: On-site registration quotas are limited, adopting a first-come-first-served system.
ref: There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: 開車進入南部非洲是一種很好的方式，能看見該地區的所有美景，也能到達一般旅遊路線以外的地方。
mt: Driving into Southern Africa is a great way to see all the beauty of the region and get to places other than general tourist routes.
ref: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes.

src: 透過仔細規劃，乘坐普通車輛也能做到，但強烈建議選擇四輪傳動車，而且許多地點只有高軸距的四輪傳動車才能抵達。
mt: Through careful planning, it can also be done by riding a regular vehicle, but it is highly recommended to choose a four-wheel drive car, and many locations are only high-axle four-wheel drive cars that can reach.
ref: This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4.

src: 規劃時請牢記在心，南非雖然安定，但並非所有鄰國都如此。
mt: Please keep in mind when planning, although South Africa is stable, not all neighboring countries are like this.
ref: Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are.

src: 各國的簽證要求和費用不盡相同，也會跟所屬國家或地區有關。
mt: Visa requirements and fees vary from country to country, and are also related to the country or region they belong to.
ref: Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from.

src: 每個國家也有各自的法律，要求車內必須放置哪些緊急物品。
mt: Each country also has its own laws, requiring emergency items to be placed inside the car.
ref: Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.

src: 維多利亞瀑布鎮位在辛巴威西部，鄰近尚比亞邊境的利文斯頓，也很靠近波札那。
mt: Victoria Falls is located in the western part of Zimbabwe, near Livingston on the Zambian border and also close to Botswana.
ref: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana.

src: 這個城鎮緊鄰著瀑布，瀑布是主要的景點，但此熱門的旅遊地點，為探險家和觀光客皆提供了許多長期停留的機會。
mt: This town is adjacent to a waterfall, the waterfall is the main scenic spot, but this popular tourist destination has provided many long-term opportunities for explorers and tourists to stay.
ref: The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay.

src: 雨季（十一月至三月）水量會高出許多，瀑布會更加壯觀。
mt: During the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be much higher, and the waterfall will be even more spectacular.
ref: In the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be higher and the Falls will be more dramatic.

src: 如果過橋或沿著瀑布旁的蜿蜒的小徑行走，保證你一定會被淋濕。
mt: If you cross a bridge or walk along the winding path by the waterfall, you're sure to get wet.
ref: You are guaranteed to get wet if you cross the bridge or walk along the trails winding near the Falls.

src: 不過，正因為水量太大，觀看瀑布本身的視線會被大量的水遮蔽！
mt: However, because the water volume is too large, the view of the waterfall itself will be blocked by a lot of water!
ref: On the other hand, it is precisely because the volume of water is so high that your viewing of the actual Falls will be obscured—by all the water!

src: 圖坦卡門之墓 (KV62)。KV62 可能是山谷中最有名的墳墓了，它是霍華德·卡特在 1922 年發現的景象──年輕國王埋葬的地方、幾乎絲毫不受損壞的皇陵。
mt: Tutankhamun's Tomb (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous tomb in the valley, a sight that Howard Carter discovered in 1922 - where the young king buried, almost without damage to the imperial tomb.
ref: Tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous of the tombs in the Valley, the scene of Howard Carter's 1922 discovery of the almost intact royal burial of the young king.

src: 相較於大多數的皇陵，小而簡約的圖坦卡門墓穴顯得幾乎不值一顧。
mt: Compared to most imperial tombs, the small and simple Tutankhamun tomb is almost worthless.
ref: Compared to most of the other royal tombs, however, the tomb of Tutankhamun is barely worth visiting, being much smaller and with limited decoration.

src: 若有任何人想要看當初人們因為試圖把木乃伊移出棺木而造成的損壞，他們只會大失所望，因為他們只能看見木乃伊的頭和肩膀。
mt: If anyone wants to see the damage caused by people trying to remove Mummy from the coffin, they will only be disappointed because they can only see Mummy's head and shoulders.
ref: Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible.

src: 陵墓裡各種令人歎為觀止的財富已不在陵墓內，而是被移往在開羅的埃及博物館。
mt: The various breathtaking wealth in the mausoleum is no longer within the mausoleum, but has been moved to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
ref: The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.

src: 時間不充裕的旅客，最好把時間花在其他地方。
mt: Passengers with insufficient time should spend their time elsewhere.
ref: Visitors with limited time would be best to spend their time elsewhere.

src: 豬山寺廟位於暹粒市西南方 12 公里處。這座山頂上的寺廟建於 9 世紀末，時值耶輸跋摩國王統治時期。
mt: The Temple of Pigs Hill is located 12 km southwest of Siem Reap city. The temple on top of this mountain was built in the late 9th century, during the reign of King Jelu-Kawama.
ref: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman.

src: 神廟陰鬱的氣氛和洞里薩湖的美景，讓攀登到山頂的這段路程值回票價。
mt: The temple's mellow atmosphere and the beautiful scenery of Donglisha Lake make the journey to the top worth the ticket price.
ref: The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile.

src: 入園參觀行程可與乘船遊湖行程合併，十分便利。
mt: It is very convenient to join the tour by boat and lake.
ref: A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake.

src: 必須持吳哥窟通行證才能進入神廟，所以去洞里薩湖時別忘了帶吳哥窟門票。
mt: You must hold a valid Angkor Wat pass to enter the temple, so don't forget to bring your Angkor Wat ticket when you go to Dongliza Lake.
ref: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.

src: 耶路撒冷是以色列的首都及最大城市，儘管大多數其他國家及聯合國並不承認它是以色列首都。
mt: Jerusalem is Israel's capital and largest city, although most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.
ref: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.

src: 猶地亞山的古城擁有長達數千年的迷人歷史。
mt: The ancient city of Mount Judea has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years.
ref: The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years.

src: 該城市是三種一神教──猶太教、基督教和伊斯蘭教的聖地，也是精神、宗教和文化的中心。
mt: The city is a sacred place of three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, as well as the center of spirit, religion and culture.
ref: The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center.

src: 由於宗教上的重要性，特別是舊城區的許多遺址，耶路撒冷成為以色列的主要觀光景點之一。
mt: Due to its religious importance, especially many archaeological sites in the Old Town, Jerusalem has become one of Israel's main tourist attractions.
ref: Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel.

src: 耶路撒冷擁有許多歷史、考古和文化景點，以及充滿活力且人潮擁擠的購物中心、咖啡廳和餐廳。
mt: Jerusalem has many historical, archaeological and cultural attractions, as well as vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafes and restaurants.
ref: Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.

src: 厄瓜多要求古巴公民在經國際機場或入境關口進入厄瓜多之前，必須收到邀請函。
mt: Ecuador requires Cuban citizens to receive an invitation letter before entering Ecuador through an international airport or immigration port.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points.

src: 此信必須經厄瓜多外交部批准，並符合相關要求。
mt: This letter must be approved by the Ecuadorian Foreign Ministry and meet relevant requirements.
ref: This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements.

src: 這些要求是為了讓兩國間的遷徙活動更井然有序。
mt: These requirements are to make migration activities between the two countries more orderly.
ref: These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries.

src: 持有美國綠卡的古巴公民應前往厄瓜多領事館，獲得這些條件的豁免權。
mt: Cuban citizens holding a U.S. green card should visit the Ecuador consulate to obtain immunity from these conditions.
ref: Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement.

src: 從旅行日期開始計算，你的護照必須擁有 6 個月以上有效期限。此外還需要來回票或前往他地機票，證明你的停留時間。
mt: Your passport must be valid for more than 6 months from the date of travel. A round-trip ticket or a ticket to another destination is also required to prove your stay.
ref: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: 越多人的旅行團價格越便宜，所以若是單獨或與一名朋友外出旅行，可以與其他人結伴組成四到六人的團體，以降低個人單價。
mt: The more people traveling, the cheaper the price; so if traveling alone or with a friend, you can form a group of four to six people together to reduce individual price.
ref: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate.

src: 但您不需要太擔心，因為通常都會有許多旅客四處詢問加入旅行團。
mt: But you don’t need to worry too much, because usually there are many travelers who go around asking about joining a tour.
ref: However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars.

src: 這似乎更像是某種騙人以為他們必須付更多錢的招數。
mt: This seems more like some trick to think they're going to have to pay more.
ref: It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.

src: 矗立在馬丘比丘北側的陡峭尖山，經常成為許多馬丘比丘遺址照片的背景。
mt: Standing on the north side of Machu Picchu, a steep and pointed mountain often serves as the background for many photographs of Machu Picchu sites.
ref: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins.

src: 它由下仰望看起來有些嚇人，坡度陡峭難以攀登。但是大部分體力正常的人應該可以在45分鐘內登頂。
mt: It looks a little scary looking down from the top, with steep slopes that are hard to climb. But most people with normal physical strength should be able to reach the summit in 45 minutes.
ref: It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes.

src: 大部分的步道都鋪設石階，地勢陡峭的路段則裝上鋼纜作為扶手。
mt: Most of the trails are paved with stone steps, while steep sections are equipped with steel cables as handrails.
ref: Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail.

src: 也就是說，要有喘不過氣的心理準備，也要特別小心較陡的部份，尤其是潮濕的時候，因為這可能迅速使情況變得危險。
mt: In other words, to be mentally prepared to catch my breath, one must also be especially careful with the steeper parts, especially when wet, because this may quickly make the situation dangerous.
ref: That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly.

src: 接近頂端的地方有個必須穿越的小洞穴，它的高度很低且擠出洞有點難度。
mt: Near the top is a small cave that must be traversed, its height is very low and it's a bit difficult to squeeze out the hole.
ref: There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.

src: 欣賞加拉巴哥美景和野生動植物的最佳方式就是乘船，一如查爾斯‧達爾文在 1835 年的作法。
mt: The best way to appreciate the beauty and wildlife of Galapagos is by boat, as Charles Darwin did in 1835.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835.

src: 超過 60 艘遊輪往返加拉巴哥群島的水域，搭載乘客數從 8 名到 100 名不等。
mt: More than 60 cruise ships travel between the waters of the Galapagos Islands, carrying passengers ranging from eight to 100.
ref: Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers.

src: 大多數遊客很早就提前訂位（旺季的船票通常一位難求）。
mt: Most tourists make reservations early (passengers usually have a hard time getting tickets during peak season).
ref: Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season).

src: 確保幫您預訂的旅行社是加拉巴哥群島的專家，並擁有對各種船隻的廣泛知識。
mt: Make sure the travel agency you booked is an expert in the Galapagos Islands and has extensive knowledge of the various vessels.
ref: Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships.

src: 這將確保您的特定興趣和/或限制會與最適合它們的船隻相符。
mt: This will ensure that your specific interests and/or restrictions will match the ships that best suit them.
ref: This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: 在西班牙人於 16 世紀抵達智利前，其北部受印加帝國統治，中部及南部則居住著原住民阿勞卡尼亞人（馬普切人）。
mt: Before the arrival of Spanish people in Chile in the 16th century, its northern part was ruled by the Inca Empire, while the central and southern parts were inhabited by indigenous Alocano people (Mapuche people).
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile.

src: 馬普切人也是最後一群獨立的美洲原住民團體之一，他們直到智利獨立後，才完全被納入西班牙語的治理。
mt: The Mapuche people were also one of the last independent Native American groups, and they were not fully incorporated into Spanish rule until Chile's independence.
ref: The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence.

src: 雖然智利在 1810 年即宣佈獨立（當時正值拿破侖戰爭，西班牙有好幾年都沒有正常運作的中央政府），但直到 1818 年才擊敗西班牙，取得決定性的勝利。
mt: Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (when the Napoleonic Wars were taking place, Spain had not had a functioning central government for several years), it was not until 1818 that they defeated Spain and achieved a decisive victory.
ref: Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

src: 多明尼加共和國（西班牙文：República Dominicana）是一個加勒比海國家，和西邊的海地共同位於伊斯帕尼奧拉島上。
mt: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country, located on the island of Hispaniola along with Haiti to the west.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti

src: 除了白色沙灘和山岳景觀，這個國家也是美洲最古老的歐式城市的所在地，就是現在是聖多明哥的一部份。
mt: In addition to the white sand beaches and mountain scenery, this country is also the site of America's oldest European-style city, which is now part of Santo Domingo.
ref: Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.

src: 此島最初的居民為泰諾人與加勒比人。加勒比人說的是阿拉瓦語系，在約公元前一萬年來到此地。
mt: The first inhabitants of the island were the Taino and the Caribbean. The Caribbean spoke of the Arava language, which came to the island around 10,000 BC.
ref: The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE.

src: 在歐洲探險家抵達後的短短幾年內，塔伊諾城的人口遭到西班牙征服者大幅地削減。
mt: In just a few years after European explorers arrived, the population of Taino City was drastically reduced by Spanish conquerors.
ref: Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors

src: 根據《弗雷·巴托洛梅·德拉斯·卡薩斯》（西印度專著），在 1492 年至 1498 年間，西班牙征服者約殺了 100,000 名泰諾人。
mt: According to the book Frey Bartolomé de las Casas (West Indian monograph), between 1492 and 1498, Spanish conquistadors killed approximately 100,000 Tainos.
ref: Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: Jardín de la Unión，是一座 17 世紀修道院修建來作為中庭使用的空間，而聖地牙哥聖殿 (Templo de san Diego) 是該修道院碩果僅存的建築。
mt: Jardín de la Unión, is a 17th-century monastery built as a courtyard space, while the Templo de san Diego is the only surviving building of the monastery.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building.

src: 如今此空間被當作中央廣場，不論日夜都十分熱鬧。
mt: Today, this space is considered a central square, and it's very lively day and night.
ref: It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night.

src: 花園周圍有幾間餐廳，下午和晚上通常在中央涼亭有免費演奏會。
mt: There are several restaurants around the garden, and there is usually a free concert at the central pavilion in the afternoon and evening.
ref: There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo.

src: Callejon del Beso（親吻小巷）。古老愛情傳說的發源地，因兩邊陽台中間間距只有 69 公分。
mt: Callejon del Beso (Kiss the Alley). The birthplace of the ancient legend of love, as the middle distance between the two balconies is only 69 cm.
ref: Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend.

src: 花幾枚硬幣，就會有小孩說故事給你聽。
mt: If you spend a few coins, a child will tell you stories.
ref: For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: 寶雲島是熱門的一日遊或週末郊遊的地點，可進行划皮艇、健行、購物和餐飲等活動。
mt: Baoyun Island is a popular one-day or weekend outing spot, where you can engage in activities such as kayaking, hiking, shopping and dining.
ref: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more.

src: 這個道地社區位於溫哥華附近的豪灣，乘坐從溫哥華市中心固蘭湖島出發的定時水上計程車就能輕鬆抵達。
mt: This authentic community is located in How Bay, near Vancouver. It is easily accessible by a scheduled water taxi from the city center of Vancouver, Goodland Lake Island.
ref: This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver.

src: 對那些喜歡戶外活動的人來說，一定要到海天走廊旅行。
mt: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, you must travel to the skywalk.
ref: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential.

src: 託 2010 冬季奧運的福，距離溫哥華車程 1.5 小時的惠斯勒又貴又出名。
mt: Whistler, a 1.5-hour drive from Vancouver, is also famous for its 2010 Winter Olympics.
ref: Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics.

src: 冬季可享受北美洲最棒的滑雪場地，夏季則可體驗最正統的登山自行車。
mt: Enjoy the best ski resorts in North America in winter and the most authentic mountain biking in summer.
ref: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.

src: 許可證必須事先預訂。你必須擁有許可證才能在錫雷納過夜。
mt: The license must be pre-booked in advance. You must have a license to stay overnight in Serena.
ref: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena.

src: 只有西雷納林區管理站提供露營地以外的合宿房與熱食。拉萊歐那、聖佩德里羅和洛斯帕托斯只提供露營地，不提供食物。
mt: Only the Sirenaline Regional Administration Station offers accommodation and hot meals outside of the campsite. Laleona, San Pedro and Los Patos only provide campsites, without food.
ref: Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service.

src: 您可能可以直接從希門尼斯港的公園管理處預定通行證，但他們不收信用卡。
mt: You may be able to book a pass directly from the Parks Office in Port Simonis, but they do not accept credit cards.
ref: It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards

src: 公園管理處（哥斯大黎加環境能源部）只簽發預計抵達時間在一個月內的許可證。
mt: The Park Management Office (Costa Rican Ministry of Environment and Energy) only issues a permit for an estimated arrival time within one month.
ref: The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival.

src: El Sol 網咖提供預約服務，費用為美金 $30，或一日票 $10；更多訊息請見科爾科瓦杜國家公園相關頁面。
mt: El Sol Internet Cafe offers reservation service for US$30 or a one-day ticket for US$10. For more information, please visit the Corcovado National Park page.
ref: CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

src: 庫克群島是一個與紐西蘭自由結盟的島國，位於南太平洋中部的玻里尼西亞。
mt: The Cook Islands are an island nation allied with New Zealand's freedom, located in the central Pacific Ocean in Polynesia.
ref: The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.

src: 這是由 15 座島嶼組成的群島，遍佈在 220 萬平方公里的海上。
mt: This is an archipelago of 15 islands, spread over a sea area of 2.2 million square kilometers.
ref: It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean.

src: 因為群島跟夏威夷同時區，所以有時又被稱為「南半球夏威夷」。
mt: Because the islands are located in the same area as Hawaii, they are sometimes also called "Hawaii of the Southern Hemisphere".
ref: With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as "Hawaii down under".

src: 雖然面積較小，但此處會讓一些年長旅客想起尚未成為美國一州、大型觀光飯店與其他開發案還沒進駐的夏威夷。
mt: Although the area is relatively small, this place will remind some elderly tourists of Hawaii, which has not yet become a U.S. state, large tourist hotels and other development projects that have not yet entered the city.
ref: Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development.

src: 庫克群島沒有任何城市，而是由十五個不同島嶼組成。主要島嶼是拉羅湯加島及艾圖塔基島。
mt: The Cook Islands do not have any cities, but are composed of 15 different islands. The main islands are Rarotonga Island and Etutaki Island.
ref: The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki.

src: 在今日的已開發國家，提供豪華的 B&B 服務已經提升為一種藝術。
mt: In the developed world today, the provision of luxurious B&B services has been elevated to an art form.
ref: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form.

src: 在高端市場中，民宿業者主要的競爭項目明顯為兩大項：寢具用品和早餐。
mt: In the high-end market, the main competition items of guesthouse operators are clearly two major items: bedding products and breakfast.
ref: At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast.

src: 因此，在最頂級的這類場所容易找到最奢華的寢具，也許是手工被單或骨董床。
mt: Therefore, it is easy to find the most luxurious bedding, perhaps hand-made or antique beds, in top-of-the-line places.
ref: Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed.

src: 早餐可能包含當地的季節性美食或民宿主人的特製佳餚。
mt: Breakfast may include local seasonal dishes or special dishes from the host of the guest house.
ref: Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish.

src: 那可能是一棟具歷史意義的老建築，擁有古董家具、修剪整齊的庭園和游泳池。
mt: It might be a historic old building with antique furniture, pruned gardens and a swimming pool.
ref: The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.

src: 坐上自己的汽車，展開一場漫長的公路之旅，這種簡單的旅行方式本身就非常有吸引力。
mt: Take your own car and start a long road trip. This simple way of traveling is very attractive in itself.
ref: Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity.

src: 與大型車輛不同，你很可能已經對於駕駛自己的車輛很熟悉，也了解它的侷限。
mt: Unlike large vehicles, you may already be familiar with driving your own vehicle and understand its limitations.
ref: Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations.

src: 在私人土地或任何大小的城鎮搭起帳棚，都很容易引起不必要的注意。
mt: Setting up tents on private land or any size of town can easily attract unnecessary attention.
ref: Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention.

src: 簡而言之，開車是進行公路旅行的好方式，但那本身鮮少是一種「露營」方式。
mt: In short, driving is a good way to travel by road, but it's rarely a "camping" method in itself.
ref: In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to "camp".

src: 如果您有一輛座椅能放平的大型迷你廂型車、休旅車、轎車或是旅行車，便能從事汽車露營。
mt: If you have a large minivan, minivan, minivan, sedan, or van with a flat seat, you can do car camping.
ref: Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down.

src: 有些旅館保留了屬於蒸氣鐵路與遠洋郵輪黃金時代的遺跡，來自於二戰前，19 世紀或 20 世紀初。
mt: Some hotels have preserved the remains of a steam railway and ocean-going cruise ship Golden Age, from before World War II, in the 19th or early 20th centuries.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries.

src: 這些飯店是當時富豪名流的下榻之處，通常飯店裡會提供高級的餐點和夜生活。
mt: These hotels were the residences of the wealthy and influential people at that time, usually offering high-end meals and nightlife in the hotel.
ref: These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife.

src: 過時的五金配件、沒有新型家電設施，以及特有的優雅年代感，都是這種飯店的特色。
mt: Outdated hardware accessories, no new home appliances, and a unique sense of elegance are all characteristics of this hotel.
ref: The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character.

src: 儘管這類旅館大多是私有的，但有時也會接待來訪的國家元首和其他達官顯貴。
mt: Although these types of hotels are mostly private, they sometimes also receive visiting heads of state and other high-ranking officials.
ref: While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries.

src: 手頭闊綽的旅客可能會考慮來趟環遊世界之旅，並在這些旅館中的幾間留宿。
mt: Passengers with big hands may consider taking a trip around the world and staying in several of these hotels.
ref: A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: 住宿交換網站是一個能將遊客和他們欲前往的城市當地人連結起來的組織。
mt: The Accommodation Exchange website is an organization that connects visitors with the locals they want to go to.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit.

src: 加入這樣的網路通常只需要填寫線上表格即可；雖然有些網路會提供或需要額外的驗證。
mt: Adding to such a network usually only requires filling out an online form; although some networks may provide or require additional verification.
ref: Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification.

src: 可供選擇的房東列表會以紙本或線上方式提供，偶爾還會附有其他旅客留下的推薦和評價。
mt: The list of hosts to choose from will be available in paper or online, with occasional recommendations and reviews from other travelers.
ref: A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers.

src: 沙發衝浪於 2004 年 1 月成立，起因是電腦程式設計師凱西‧芬頓找到廉價班機飛往冰島，卻沒地方住。
mt: Couchsurfing was established in January 2004, due to computer programmer Casey Fenton finding a cheap flight to Iceland but no place to stay.
ref: Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay.

src: 他寄電郵給當地大學的學生，接著收到大量免費住宿的邀請。
mt: He emailed students from local universities, and then received a large number of free accommodation invitations.
ref: He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

src: 青年旅社的主要客群是年輕人，典型房客是 20 來歲的年輕人，但也常會在那裡看到年紀較大的旅客。
mt: The main clientele of the youth hostel is young people, typical guests are young people in their 20s, but they often see older travelers there.
ref: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too.

src: 帶著小孩的家庭極為少見，但有些青年旅館確實會允許他們入住私人套房。
mt: Families with children are extremely rare, but some hostels do allow them to stay in private suites.
ref: Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.

src: 中國的北京市將主辦 2022 年的冬季奧林匹克運動會，這將使北京成為第一座主辦過夏季與冬季奧運的城市。
mt: China's Beijing city will host the 2022 Winter Olympics, making Beijing the first city to host both the Summer and Winter Olympics.
ref: The city of Beijing in China will be the host city of the Olympic Winter Games in 2022, which will make it the first city to have hosted both the summer and winter Olympics.

src: 北京將主辦開幕及閉幕式，還有室內冰上項目。
mt: Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies, as well as indoor ice projects.
ref: Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and the indoor ice events.

src: 其他滑雪活動將在張家口的太子城滑雪區進行，距離北京約 220 公里（140 英里）。
mt: Other skiing activities will be held at the Prince Town Ski Area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 kilometers (140 miles) from Beijing.
ref: Other skiing events will be at the Taizicheng ski area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 km (140 miles) from Beijing.

src: 從十一月底到五月中，大多數寺廟都會舉辦年度慶典，確切日期則依每間寺廟的年度行事曆而定。
mt: From late November to mid-May, most temples will hold annual festivals, with the exact date determined by each temple's annual calendar.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar.

src: 大部分的廟宇慶典都是為了慶祝寺廟週年、主祀神祉的生日、或其他與該廟宇相關的重要活動。
mt: Most temple festivals are to celebrate the temple's anniversary, the birthday of the deity deity, or other important activities related to the temple.
ref: Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple.

src: 去喀拉拉邦看寺廟慶典挺有意思的，他們定期會有佩戴裝飾的大象遊行、寺廟樂團及其他慶典。
mt: It's very interesting to go to Kerala and see the temple festivals. They regularly have decorated elephant parades, temple bands and other celebrations.
ref: Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: 世界博覽會（亦稱萬國博覽會，或簡稱世博會）是一個大型的國際藝術與科學展覽活動。
mt: The World Expo (also known as the World Expo, or simply the World Expo) is a large-scale international art and science exhibition event.
ref: A World's Fair (commonly called World Exposition, or simply Expo) is large international festival of arts and sciences.

src: 參與國會在各自的國家館設置藝術或教育展，用以展示世界議題或該國的文化與歷史。
